built with pdoc

personal_agent

Personal AI Agent package initialization.

This module serves as the main entry point for the Personal AI Agent package, providing a comprehensive suite of AI-powered tools and capabilities including:

  • Multi-framework support: LangChain, smolagents, and Agno frameworks
  • Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration with multiple servers
  • Weaviate vector database for persistent memory
  • Advanced memory management with semantic deduplication
  • Comprehensive tool suite for file operations, web research, and system tasks
  • Multiple interface options: Streamlit, Flask, and CLI
  • Modular architecture with organized code structure

The package supports three main frameworks:

  1. LangChain ReAct (legacy support)
  2. Smolagents (multi-agent coordination)
  3. Agno (modern async agent framework) - primary interface

Author: Personal Agent Development Team Last modified: 2025-07-10 15:12:58 Version: 0.8.7.dev

  1"""Personal AI Agent package initialization.
  2
  3This module serves as the main entry point for the Personal AI Agent package,
  4providing a comprehensive suite of AI-powered tools and capabilities including:
  5
  6- Multi-framework support: LangChain, smolagents, and Agno frameworks
  7- Model Context Protocol (MCP) integration with multiple servers
  8- Weaviate vector database for persistent memory
  9- Advanced memory management with semantic deduplication
 10- Comprehensive tool suite for file operations, web research, and system tasks
 11- Multiple interface options: Streamlit, Flask, and CLI
 12- Modular architecture with organized code structure
 13
 14The package supports three main frameworks:
 151. LangChain ReAct (legacy support)
 162. Smolagents (multi-agent coordination)
 173. Agno (modern async agent framework) - primary interface
 18
 19Author: Personal Agent Development Team
 20Last modified: 2025-07-10 15:12:58
 21Version: 0.8.7.dev
 22"""
 23
 24# pylint: disable=C0413
 25
 26import logging
 27import os
 28
 29# Set Rust logging to ERROR level to suppress Lance warnings before any imports
 30if "RUST_LOG" not in os.environ:
 31    os.environ["RUST_LOG"] = "error"
 32
 33# Import core components
 34from .config import USE_MCP, USE_WEAVIATE, get_mcp_servers
 35from .core import SimpleMCPClient, create_agent_executor, setup_weaviate
 36from .core.memory import is_weaviate_connected, vector_store, weaviate_client
 37
 38# Import key classes for pdoc documentation
 39from .core.agno_agent import AgnoPersonalAgent, create_agno_agent, create_simple_personal_agent, load_agent_knowledge
 40from .core.semantic_memory_manager import (
 41    SemanticMemoryManager,
 42    MemoryStorageStatus,
 43    MemoryStorageResult,
 44    SemanticDuplicateDetector,
 45    create_semantic_memory_manager
 46)
 47from .core.agent_memory_manager import AgentMemoryManager
 48from .core.agent_instruction_manager import AgentInstructionManager
 49from .core.agent_knowledge_manager import AgentKnowledgeManager
 50from .core.agent_tool_manager import AgentToolManager
 51from .core.agent_model_manager import AgentModelManager
 52
 53# Import tools
 54from .tools import get_all_tools
 55
 56# Import utilities
 57from .utils import cleanup, inject_dependencies, register_cleanup_handlers
 58from .utils.pag_logging import (
 59    configure_all_rich_logging,
 60    configure_master_logger,
 61    disable_stream_handlers_for_namespace,
 62    list_all_loggers,
 63    list_handlers,
 64    set_logger_level,
 65    set_logger_level_for_module,
 66    set_logging_level_for_all_handlers,
 67    setup_agno_rich_logging,
 68    setup_logging,
 69    setup_logging_filters,
 70    toggle_stream_handler,
 71)
 72
 73# Import web interface
 74from .web import create_app, register_routes
 75
 76# Package version (matches pyproject.toml)
 77__version__ = "0.9.2dev"  # Defined once to avoid duplication
 78
 79# Setup package and module-level logging
 80# Configure logging for the package
 81
 82# Disable master logger to avoid duplicate logs
 83configure_master_logger(disabled=False)
 84
 85# Disable annoying warnings
 86setup_logging_filters()
 87
 88# Package-level logger
 89_logger = setup_logging()
 90

155# Only log initialization message if log level allows it AND root logger allows it
156# This prevents spam when scripts want to suppress logging
157root_logger = logging.getLogger()
158if _logger.isEnabledFor(logging.INFO) and root_logger.isEnabledFor(logging.INFO):
159    _logger.info("Initializing Personal AI Agent package v%s...", __version__)
160    
161    # Debug logging for pdoc class discovery
162    _logger.info("PDOC DEBUG: Listing all imported classes and modules:")
163    import inspect
164    import sys
165    current_module = sys.modules[__name__]
166    for name, obj in inspect.getmembers(current_module):
167        if inspect.isclass(obj) or inspect.ismodule(obj):
168            _logger.info("PDOC DEBUG: Found %s: %s", "class" if inspect.isclass(obj) else "module", name)
169    
170    _logger.info("PDOC DEBUG: __all__ list contains %d items", len(__all__))
171

175from .langchain_main import cli_main as langchain_cli_main
176from .langchain_main import main as langchain_main
177from .smol_main import run_smolagents_cli, run_smolagents_web

180def print_configuration() -> str:
181    """Print comprehensive configuration information for the Personal AI Agent.
182
183    Uses the enhanced configuration display method from the module's tools.
184
185    :return: Configuration information as formatted string
186    """
187    try:
188        # Import and use the enhanced display function from the module's tools
189        from .tools.show_config import show_config
190
191        # Call the show_config function with default colored output
192        show_config()
193
194        return "Configuration displayed successfully using module tools.show_config method."
195
196    except Exception as e:
197        # Fallback to the settings.print_config() method if enhanced method fails
198        _logger.warning("Could not use module tools.show_config display: %s", e)
199
200        try:
201            from .config.settings import print_config
202
203            print_config()
204            return "Configuration displayed successfully using settings.print_config() fallback."
205        except ImportError as fallback_error:
206            _logger.warning(
207                "Could not import settings.print_config: %s", fallback_error
208            )
209
210            # Final fallback to basic configuration display
211            from .config import get_mcp_servers
212            from .config.settings import (
213                AGNO_KNOWLEDGE_DIR,
214                AGNO_STORAGE_DIR,
215                DATA_DIR,
216                HOME_DIR,
217                LLM_MODEL,
218                LOG_LEVEL_STR,
219                OLLAMA_URL,
220                REPO_DIR,
221                ROOT_DIR,
222                STORAGE_BACKEND,
223                USE_MCP,
224                USE_WEAVIATE,
225                WEAVIATE_URL,
226            )
227
228            config_lines = [
229                "=" * 80,
230                " PERSONAL AI AGENT CONFIGURATION",
231                "=" * 80,
232                "",
233                " CORE SETTINGS:",
234                f"   Package Version: {__version__}",
235                f"   LLM Model: {LLM_MODEL}",
236                f"   Storage Backend: {STORAGE_BACKEND}",
237                f"   Log Level: {LOG_LEVEL_STR}",
238                "",
239                " SERVICE ENDPOINTS:",
240                f"   Ollama URL: {OLLAMA_URL}",
241                f"   Weaviate URL: {WEAVIATE_URL}",
242                "",
243                " FEATURE FLAGS:",
244                f"   Weaviate Enabled: {'' if USE_WEAVIATE else ''} ({USE_WEAVIATE})",
245                f"   MCP Enabled: {'' if USE_MCP else ''} ({USE_MCP})",
246                "",
247                " DIRECTORY CONFIGURATION:",
248                f"   Root Directory: {ROOT_DIR}",
249                f"   Home Directory: {HOME_DIR}",
250                f"   Data Directory: {DATA_DIR}",
251                f"   Repository Directory: {REPO_DIR}",
252                f"   Agno Storage Directory: {AGNO_STORAGE_DIR}",
253                f"   Agno Knowledge Directory: {AGNO_KNOWLEDGE_DIR}",
254                "",
255                "=" * 80,
256                " Configuration loaded successfully!",
257                "=" * 80,
258            ]
259
260            # Join and print
261            config_text = "\n".join(config_lines)
262            print(config_text)
263            return config_text
264
265
266# The __all__ list has been moved above to fix the "using variable before assignment" issue
class SimpleMCPClient: 
 16class SimpleMCPClient:
 17    """Simple MCP client based on the working test_mcp.py implementation."""
 18
 19    def __init__(self, server_configs: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]):
 20        self.server_configs = server_configs
 21        self.active_servers = {}
 22
 23    def start_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool:
 24        """Start an MCP server process synchronously."""
 25        if server_name not in self.server_configs:
 26            logger.error("Unknown MCP server: %s", server_name)
 27            return False
 28
 29        if server_name in self.active_servers:
 30            logger.info("MCP server %s already running", server_name)
 31            return True
 32
 33        config = self.server_configs[server_name]
 34        try:
 35            # Start the MCP server process
 36            # Set working directory based on the server root path
 37            cwd = None
 38            if server_name == "filesystem-home":
 39                cwd = ROOT_DIR
 40            elif server_name == "filesystem-data":
 41                cwd = DATA_DIR
 42
 43            # Prepare environment variables
 44            env = os.environ.copy()  # Start with current environment
 45            if "env" in config:
 46                env.update(config["env"])  # Add server-specific env vars
 47
 48            process = subprocess.Popen(
 49                [config["command"]] + config["args"],
 50                stdin=subprocess.PIPE,
 51                stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
 52                stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
 53                text=True,
 54                bufsize=0,
 55                cwd=cwd,
 56                env=env,  # Pass environment variables
 57            )
 58
 59            self.active_servers[server_name] = {"process": process, "config": config}
 60
 61            # Wait a moment for server to start
 62            time.sleep(1)
 63
 64            # Initialize the server
 65            if self._initialize_server_sync(server_name):
 66                logger.info("Started MCP server: %s", server_name)
 67                return True
 68            else:
 69                logger.error("Failed to initialize MCP server: %s", server_name)
 70                return False
 71
 72        except Exception as e:
 73            logger.error("Failed to start MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
 74            return False
 75
 76    def _initialize_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool:
 77        """Initialize server synchronously."""
 78        try:
 79            # Send initialize request
 80            init_request = {
 81                "jsonrpc": "2.0",
 82                "id": 1,
 83                "method": "initialize",
 84                "params": {
 85                    "protocolVersion": "2024-11-05",
 86                    "capabilities": {"tools": {}},
 87                    "clientInfo": {"name": "personal-agent", "version": "0.1.0"},
 88                },
 89            }
 90
 91            response = self._send_request_sync(server_name, init_request)
 92            if response and response.get("result"):
 93                logger.info("Initialized MCP server: %s", server_name)
 94                return True
 95
 96        except Exception as e:
 97            logger.error("Failed to initialize MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
 98
 99        return False
100
101    def _send_request_sync(
102        self, server_name: str, request: Dict[str, Any]
103    ) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
104        """Send a JSON-RPC request to an MCP server synchronously."""
105        if server_name not in self.active_servers:
106            return None
107
108        try:
109            process = self.active_servers[server_name]["process"]
110            request_json = json.dumps(request) + "\n"
111
112            # Send request
113            process.stdin.write(request_json)
114            process.stdin.flush()
115
116            # Read response
117            response_line = process.stdout.readline()
118            if response_line:
119                return json.loads(response_line.strip())
120
121        except Exception as e:
122            logger.error("Error sending request to MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
123
124        return None
125
126    def call_tool_sync(
127        self, server_name: str, tool_name: str, arguments: Dict[str, Any]
128    ) -> str:
129        """Call a tool on an MCP server synchronously."""
130        try:
131            request = {
132                "jsonrpc": "2.0",
133                "id": 3,
134                "method": "tools/call",
135                "params": {"name": tool_name, "arguments": arguments},
136            }
137
138            response = self._send_request_sync(server_name, request)
139            if response and response.get("result"):
140                content = response["result"].get("content", [])
141                if content and len(content) > 0:
142                    return content[0].get("text", "No response")
143
144        except Exception as e:
145            logger.error(
146                "Error calling tool %s on server %s: %s", tool_name, server_name, e
147            )
148
149        return f"Error calling tool {tool_name}"
150
151    def list_tools_sync(self, server_name: str) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
152        """List available tools on an MCP server synchronously."""
153        try:
154            request = {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id": 2, "method": "tools/list"}
155
156            response = self._send_request_sync(server_name, request)
157            if response and response.get("result"):
158                tools = response["result"].get("tools", [])
159                logger.debug(
160                    "Available tools on %s: %s",
161                    server_name,
162                    [tool.get("name") for tool in tools],
163                )
164                return tools
165
166        except Exception as e:
167            logger.error("Error listing tools on server %s: %s", server_name, e)
168
169        return []
170
171    def stop_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool:
172        """Stop a specific MCP server."""
173        if server_name not in self.active_servers:
174            logger.debug("MCP server %s not running", server_name)
175            return True
176
177        try:
178            server_info = self.active_servers[server_name]
179            process = server_info["process"]
180
181            # Terminate the process
182            process.terminate()
183
184            # Wait for it to exit gracefully
185            try:
186                process.wait(timeout=3)
187            except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
188                # Force kill if it doesn't exit gracefully
189                process.kill()
190                process.wait()
191
192            # Remove from active servers
193            del self.active_servers[server_name]
194            logger.info("Stopped MCP server: %s", server_name)
195            return True
196
197        except Exception as e:
198            logger.error("Error stopping MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
199            return False
200
201    def start_servers(
202        self, server_configs: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]] = None
203    ) -> bool:
204        """Start all configured MCP servers."""
205        configs = server_configs or self.server_configs
206        success = True
207
208        for server_name in configs:
209            if not self.start_server_sync(server_name):
210                logger.error("Failed to start MCP server: %s", server_name)
211                success = False
212
213        return success
214
215    def stop_all_servers(self):
216        """Stop all active MCP servers."""
217        for server_name, server_info in self.active_servers.items():
218            try:
219                process = server_info["process"]
220                process.terminate()
221                process.wait(timeout=5)  # Wait up to 5 seconds
222                logger.info("Stopped MCP server: %s", server_name)
223            except Exception as e:
224                logger.error("Error stopping MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
225
226        self.active_servers.clear()

Simple MCP client based on the working test_mcp.py implementation.

SimpleMCPClient(server_configs: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]) 
19    def __init__(self, server_configs: Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]):
20        self.server_configs = server_configs
21        self.active_servers = {}
server_configs
active_servers
def start_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool: 
23    def start_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool:
24        """Start an MCP server process synchronously."""
25        if server_name not in self.server_configs:
26            logger.error("Unknown MCP server: %s", server_name)
27            return False
28
29        if server_name in self.active_servers:
30            logger.info("MCP server %s already running", server_name)
31            return True
32
33        config = self.server_configs[server_name]
34        try:
35            # Start the MCP server process
36            # Set working directory based on the server root path
37            cwd = None
38            if server_name == "filesystem-home":
39                cwd = ROOT_DIR
40            elif server_name == "filesystem-data":
41                cwd = DATA_DIR
42
43            # Prepare environment variables
44            env = os.environ.copy()  # Start with current environment
45            if "env" in config:
46                env.update(config["env"])  # Add server-specific env vars
47
48            process = subprocess.Popen(
49                [config["command"]] + config["args"],
50                stdin=subprocess.PIPE,
51                stdout=subprocess.PIPE,
52                stderr=subprocess.PIPE,
53                text=True,
54                bufsize=0,
55                cwd=cwd,
56                env=env,  # Pass environment variables
57            )
58
59            self.active_servers[server_name] = {"process": process, "config": config}
60
61            # Wait a moment for server to start
62            time.sleep(1)
63
64            # Initialize the server
65            if self._initialize_server_sync(server_name):
66                logger.info("Started MCP server: %s", server_name)
67                return True
68            else:
69                logger.error("Failed to initialize MCP server: %s", server_name)
70                return False
71
72        except Exception as e:
73            logger.error("Failed to start MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
74            return False

Start an MCP server process synchronously.

def call_tool_sync(self, server_name: str, tool_name: str, arguments: Dict[str, Any]) -> str: 
126    def call_tool_sync(
127        self, server_name: str, tool_name: str, arguments: Dict[str, Any]
128    ) -> str:
129        """Call a tool on an MCP server synchronously."""
130        try:
131            request = {
132                "jsonrpc": "2.0",
133                "id": 3,
134                "method": "tools/call",
135                "params": {"name": tool_name, "arguments": arguments},
136            }
137
138            response = self._send_request_sync(server_name, request)
139            if response and response.get("result"):
140                content = response["result"].get("content", [])
141                if content and len(content) > 0:
142                    return content[0].get("text", "No response")
143
144        except Exception as e:
145            logger.error(
146                "Error calling tool %s on server %s: %s", tool_name, server_name, e
147            )
148
149        return f"Error calling tool {tool_name}"

Call a tool on an MCP server synchronously.

def list_tools_sync(self, server_name: str) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]: 
151    def list_tools_sync(self, server_name: str) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
152        """List available tools on an MCP server synchronously."""
153        try:
154            request = {"jsonrpc": "2.0", "id": 2, "method": "tools/list"}
155
156            response = self._send_request_sync(server_name, request)
157            if response and response.get("result"):
158                tools = response["result"].get("tools", [])
159                logger.debug(
160                    "Available tools on %s: %s",
161                    server_name,
162                    [tool.get("name") for tool in tools],
163                )
164                return tools
165
166        except Exception as e:
167            logger.error("Error listing tools on server %s: %s", server_name, e)
168
169        return []

List available tools on an MCP server synchronously.

def stop_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool: 
171    def stop_server_sync(self, server_name: str) -> bool:
172        """Stop a specific MCP server."""
173        if server_name not in self.active_servers:
174            logger.debug("MCP server %s not running", server_name)
175            return True
176
177        try:
178            server_info = self.active_servers[server_name]
179            process = server_info["process"]
180
181            # Terminate the process
182            process.terminate()
183
184            # Wait for it to exit gracefully
185            try:
186                process.wait(timeout=3)
187            except subprocess.TimeoutExpired:
188                # Force kill if it doesn't exit gracefully
189                process.kill()
190                process.wait()
191
192            # Remove from active servers
193            del self.active_servers[server_name]
194            logger.info("Stopped MCP server: %s", server_name)
195            return True
196
197        except Exception as e:
198            logger.error("Error stopping MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
199            return False

Stop a specific MCP server.

def start_servers(self, server_configs: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]] = None) -> bool: 
201    def start_servers(
202        self, server_configs: Optional[Dict[str, Dict[str, Any]]] = None
203    ) -> bool:
204        """Start all configured MCP servers."""
205        configs = server_configs or self.server_configs
206        success = True
207
208        for server_name in configs:
209            if not self.start_server_sync(server_name):
210                logger.error("Failed to start MCP server: %s", server_name)
211                success = False
212
213        return success

Start all configured MCP servers.

def stop_all_servers(self): 
215    def stop_all_servers(self):
216        """Stop all active MCP servers."""
217        for server_name, server_info in self.active_servers.items():
218            try:
219                process = server_info["process"]
220                process.terminate()
221                process.wait(timeout=5)  # Wait up to 5 seconds
222                logger.info("Stopped MCP server: %s", server_name)
223            except Exception as e:
224                logger.error("Error stopping MCP server %s: %s", server_name, e)
225
226        self.active_servers.clear()

Stop all active MCP servers.

def create_agent_executor( tools: List[langchain_core.tools.base.BaseTool]) -> langchain.agents.agent.AgentExecutor: 
17def create_agent_executor(tools: List[BaseTool]) -> AgentExecutor:
18    """Create the ReAct agent executor with the provided tools."""
19
20    # Initialize Ollama LLM
21    llm = ChatOllama(model=LLM_MODEL, temperature=0.7, base_url=OLLAMA_URL)
22
23    # System prompt for the agent
24    system_prompt = """You are a helpful personal assistant with access to various tools for file operations, knowledge management, web search, and GitHub integration.
25
26You have access to the following tools:
27{tools}
28
29Use the following format:
30
31Question: the input question you must answer
32Thought: you should always think about what to do
33Action: the action to take, should be one of [{tool_names}]
34Action Input: the input to the action as valid JSON (e.g., {{"param1": "value1", "param2": "value2"}})
35Observation: the result of the action
36... (this Thought/Action/Action Input/Observation can repeat N times)
37Thought: I now know the final answer
38Final Answer: the final answer to the original input question
39
40IMPORTANT: Action Input must be valid JSON format. For example:
41- Correct: {{"file_path": "~/test.txt", "content": "Hello world"}}
42- Incorrect: file_path = '~/test.txt', content = '''Hello world'''
43
44When storing information, always use a relevant topic to categorize it for better retrieval.
45When working with files, prefer using absolute paths and be careful about file permissions.
46Always store important interactions in memory for future reference. When asked about Github
47repositories, use the GitHub tool to search for repositories and provide relevant information.
48When asked about the weather, use the weather tool to get current conditions. When asked about
49the news, use the news tool to get the latest headlines.
50
51Begin!
52
53Question: {input}
54Thought: {agent_scratchpad}"""
55
56    # Create prompt template
57    prompt = PromptTemplate.from_template(system_prompt)
58
59    # Create the ReAct agent
60    agent = create_react_agent(llm, tools, prompt)
61
62    # Create agent executor
63    agent_executor = AgentExecutor(
64        agent=agent,
65        tools=tools,
66        verbose=True,
67        max_iterations=10,
68        handle_parsing_errors=True,
69    )
70
71    logger.info("Created agent executor with %d tools", len(tools))
72    return agent_executor

Create the ReAct agent executor with the provided tools.

def setup_weaviate() -> bool: 
 31def setup_weaviate() -> bool:
 32    """
 33    Setup Weaviate client and vector store. Returns True if successful.
 34
 35    :return: True if Weaviate setup succeeded, False otherwise
 36    """
 37    global vector_store, weaviate_client
 38
 39    if not USE_WEAVIATE:
 40        logger.info("Weaviate disabled by configuration")
 41        return False
 42
 43    try:
 44        # Verify Weaviate is running with retries
 45        for attempt in range(5):
 46            logger.info(
 47                "Attempting to connect to Weaviate at %s (attempt %d/5)",
 48                WEAVIATE_URL,
 49                attempt + 1,
 50            )
 51            response = requests.get(f"{WEAVIATE_URL}/v1/.well-known/ready", timeout=10)
 52            if response.status_code == 200:
 53                logger.info("Weaviate is ready")
 54                break
 55            else:
 56                raise RuntimeError(f"Weaviate returned status {response.status_code}")
 57        else:
 58            # If we've exhausted all attempts
 59            logger.error(
 60                "Cannot connect to Weaviate at %s after 5 attempts",
 61                WEAVIATE_URL,
 62            )
 63            return False
 64
 65    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
 66        logger.error("Attempt %d/5: Error connecting to Weaviate: %s", attempt + 1, e)
 67        if attempt == 4:
 68            logger.error(
 69                "Cannot connect to Weaviate at %s, proceeding without Weaviate",
 70                WEAVIATE_URL,
 71            )
 72            return False
 73        time.sleep(10)
 74
 75    # Parse WEAVIATE_URL to create ConnectionParams
 76    parsed_url = parse_url(WEAVIATE_URL)
 77    connection_params = ConnectionParams.from_params(
 78        http_host=parsed_url.host or "localhost",
 79        http_port=parsed_url.port or 8080,
 80        http_secure=parsed_url.scheme == "https",
 81        grpc_host=parsed_url.host or "localhost",
 82        grpc_port=50051,  # Weaviate's default gRPC port
 83        grpc_secure=parsed_url.scheme == "https",
 84    )
 85
 86    # Initialize Weaviate client !!!
 87    try:
 88        weaviate_client = WeaviateClient(
 89            connection_params,
 90            skip_init_checks=True,
 91            additional_headers={
 92                "X-OpenAI-Api-Key": os.environ[
 93                    "OPENAI_API_KEY"
 94                ]  # Add inference API keys as needed
 95            },
 96        )
 97        weaviate_client.connect()  # Explicitly connect
 98        collection_name = "UserKnowledgeBase"
 99
100        # Create Weaviate collection if it doesn't exist
101        if not weaviate_client.collections.exists(collection_name):
102            logger.info("Creating Weaviate collection: %s", collection_name)
103            weaviate_client.collections.create(
104                name=collection_name,
105                properties=[
106                    wvc.Property(name="text", data_type=wvc.DataType.TEXT),
107                    wvc.Property(name="timestamp", data_type=wvc.DataType.DATE),
108                    wvc.Property(name="topic", data_type=wvc.DataType.TEXT),
109                ],
110                vectorizer_config=wvc.Configure.Vectorizer.text2vec_ollama(
111                    api_endpoint="http://host.docker.internal:11434",
112                    model="nomic-embed-text",
113                ),
114            )
115    except ImportError as e:
116        logger.error("Import error initializing Weaviate client or collection: %s", e)
117        return False
118    except AttributeError as e:
119        logger.error(
120            "Attribute error initializing Weaviate client or collection: %s", e
121        )
122        return False
123    except Exception as e:
124        logger.error(
125            "Unexpected error initializing Weaviate client or collection: %s", e
126        )
127        return False
128
129    # Initialize Weaviate vector store
130    try:
131        vector_store = WeaviateVectorStore(
132            client=weaviate_client,
133            index_name=collection_name,
134            text_key="text",
135            embedding=OllamaEmbeddings(model="nomic-embed-text", base_url=OLLAMA_URL),
136            attributes=["timestamp", "topic"],
137        )
138        logger.info("Successfully initialized Weaviate vector store")
139        return True
140    except Exception as e:
141        logger.error("Error initializing vector store: %s", e)
142        return False

Setup Weaviate client and vector store. Returns True if successful.

Returns

True if Weaviate setup succeeded, False otherwise

def is_weaviate_connected() -> bool: 
145def is_weaviate_connected() -> bool:
146    """
147    Check if Weaviate is available and connected.
148
149    :return: True if Weaviate is connected and ready, False otherwise
150    """
151    if not USE_WEAVIATE:
152        return False
153
154    if weaviate_client is None:
155        return False
156
157    try:
158        # Check if Weaviate is ready via HTTP endpoint
159        response = requests.get(f"{WEAVIATE_URL}/v1/.well-known/ready", timeout=5)
160        if response.status_code != 200:
161            return False
162
163        # Additionally check database health and attempt recovery if needed
164        return reset_weaviate_if_corrupted()
165
166    except (requests.exceptions.RequestException, Exception) as e:
167        logger.debug("Weaviate connection check failed: %s", e)
168        return False

Check if Weaviate is available and connected.

Returns

True if Weaviate is connected and ready, False otherwise

vector_store = None
weaviate_client = None
class AgnoPersonalAgent: 
 68class AgnoPersonalAgent:
 69    """
 70    Refactored Agno-based Personal AI Agent with MCP integration and native storage.
 71
 72    This class coordinates the different components of the agent system,
 73    delegating specific responsibilities to specialized manager classes.
 74    """
 75
 76    def __init__(
 77        self,
 78        model_provider: str = "ollama",
 79        model_name: str = LLM_MODEL,
 80        enable_memory: bool = True,
 81        enable_mcp: bool = True,
 82        storage_dir: str = AGNO_STORAGE_DIR,
 83        knowledge_dir: str = AGNO_KNOWLEDGE_DIR,
 84        debug: bool = False,
 85        ollama_base_url: str = OLLAMA_URL,
 86        user_id: str = USER_ID,
 87        recreate: bool = False,
 88        instruction_level: InstructionLevel = InstructionLevel.STANDARD,
 89        seed: Optional[int] = None,
 90    ) -> None:
 91        """Initialize the Agno Personal Agent.
 92
 93        Args:
 94            model_provider: LLM provider ('ollama' or 'openai')
 95            model_name: Model name to use
 96            enable_memory: Whether to enable memory and knowledge features
 97            enable_mcp: Whether to enable MCP tool integration
 98            storage_dir: Directory for Agno storage files
 99            knowledge_dir: Directory containing knowledge files to load
100            debug: Enable debug logging and tool call visibility
101            ollama_base_url: Base URL for Ollama API
102            user_id: User identifier for memory operations
103            recreate: Whether to recreate knowledge bases
104            instruction_level: The sophistication level for agent instructions
105            seed: Optional seed for model reproducibility
106        """
107        # Basic configuration
108        self.model_provider = model_provider
109        self.model_name = model_name
110        self.enable_memory = enable_memory
111        self.enable_mcp = enable_mcp and USE_MCP
112        self.debug = debug
113        self.ollama_base_url = ollama_base_url
114        self.user_id = user_id
115        self.recreate = recreate
116        self.instruction_level = instruction_level
117        self.seed = seed
118
119        # Set up storage paths
120        self._setup_storage_paths(storage_dir, knowledge_dir, user_id)
121
122        # MCP configuration
123        self.mcp_servers = get_mcp_servers() if self.enable_mcp else {}
124
125        # Initialize component managers
126        self.model_manager: AgentModelManager = AgentModelManager(
127            model_provider, model_name, ollama_base_url, seed
128        )
129
130        self.instruction_manager: AgentInstructionManager = AgentInstructionManager(
131            instruction_level, user_id, enable_memory, self.enable_mcp, self.mcp_servers
132        )
133
134        self.memory_manager: AgentMemoryManager = AgentMemoryManager(
135            user_id,
136            self.storage_dir,
137            None,  # agno_memory will be set during initialization
138            LIGHTRAG_URL,
139            LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_URL,
140            enable_memory,
141        )
142
143        self.knowledge_manager: AgentKnowledgeManager = AgentKnowledgeManager(
144            user_id, self.storage_dir, LIGHTRAG_URL, LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_URL
145        )
146
147        self.tool_manager: AgentToolManager = AgentToolManager(
148            user_id, self.storage_dir
149        )
150
151        # Storage components
152        self.agno_storage = None
153        self.agno_knowledge = None
154        self.lightrag_knowledge = None
155        self.lightrag_knowledge_enabled = False
156        self.agno_memory = None
157        self.knowledge_coordinator = None
158
159        # Agent instance
160        self.agent = None
161        self._last_response = None
162
163        logger.info(
164            "Initialized AgnoPersonalAgent with model=%s, memory=%s, mcp=%s, user_id=%s",
165            f"{model_provider}:{model_name}",
166            self.enable_memory,
167            self.enable_mcp,
168            self.user_id,
169        )
170
171    def _setup_storage_paths(
172        self, storage_dir: str, knowledge_dir: str, user_id: str
173    ) -> None:
174        """Set up storage paths based on user ID.
175
176        Args:
177            storage_dir: Default storage directory
178            knowledge_dir: Default knowledge directory
179            user_id: User identifier
180        """
181        # If user_id differs from default, create user-specific paths
182        if user_id != USER_ID:
183            # Replace the default user ID in the paths with the custom user ID
184            self.storage_dir = os.path.expandvars(
185                f"{DATA_DIR}/{STORAGE_BACKEND}/{user_id}"
186            )
187            self.knowledge_dir = os.path.expandvars(
188                f"{DATA_DIR}/{STORAGE_BACKEND}/{user_id}/knowledge"
189            )
190        else:
191            self.storage_dir = storage_dir
192            self.knowledge_dir = knowledge_dir
193
194    async def initialize(self, recreate: bool = False) -> bool:
195        """Initialize the agno agent with all components.
196
197        Args:
198            recreate: Whether to recreate the agent knowledge bases
199
200        Returns:
201            True if initialization successful, False otherwise
202        """
203        logger.info(
204            " AgnoPersonalAgent.initialize() called with recreate=%s", recreate
205        )
206
207        # CRITICAL: Synchronize the agent's user_id with the persistent user setting
208        try:
209            from ..config import get_current_user_id
210            from .user_manager import UserManager
211
212            user_manager = UserManager()
213            persistent_user_id = (
214                get_current_user_id()
215            )  # This is loaded from env.userid at startup
216
217            if self.user_id != persistent_user_id:
218                logger.warning(
219                    "Agent initialized with user '%s', but persistent user is '%s'. Switching context...",
220                    self.user_id,
221                    persistent_user_id,
222                )
223                # This is a formal user switch. Update the persistent user file.
224                switch_result = user_manager.switch_user(
225                    self.user_id, restart_lightrag=True, update_global_config=True
226                )
227                if not switch_result.get(
228                    "success"
229                ) and "Already logged in" not in switch_result.get("error", ""):
230                    raise RuntimeError(
231                        f"Failed to switch user context to '{self.user_id}': {switch_result.get('error')}"
232                    )
233                else:
234                    logger.info(
235                        "Successfully switched user context to '%s'", self.user_id
236                    )
237
238        except Exception as e:
239            logger.error(" Critical error during user context synchronization: %s", e)
240            # This is a critical step, so we raise an exception if it fails.
241            raise RuntimeError(f"User context synchronization failed: {e}") from e
242
243        # CRITICAL: Ensure user is registered in the user registry
244        logger.info(" Ensuring user %s is registered in user registry", self.user_id)
245        try:
246            from .user_registry import UserRegistry
247
248            user_registry = UserRegistry()
249            user_registry.ensure_current_user_registered()
250            logger.info(" User registration check completed")
251        except Exception as e:
252            logger.warning(" User registry check failed: %s", e)
253            # Don't fail initialization for user registry issues
254
255        # CRITICAL: Ensure Docker USER_ID consistency with smart restart capability
256        logger.info(" Checking Docker USER_ID consistency for user: %s", self.user_id)
257        try:
258            ready_to_proceed, consistency_message = ensure_docker_user_consistency(
259                user_id=self.user_id, auto_fix=True, force_restart=False  # Only restart if actually needed
260            )
261
262            if ready_to_proceed:
263                logger.info(
264                    " Docker consistency check passed: %s", consistency_message
265                )
266            else:
267                logger.error(
268                    " Docker consistency check failed: %s", consistency_message
269                )
270                raise RuntimeError(
271                    f"Docker USER_ID consistency check failed: {consistency_message}"
272                )
273
274        except Exception as e:
275            logger.error(" Critical error during Docker consistency check: %s", e)
276            # Don't fail initialization for Docker consistency issues in case Docker is not available
277            logger.warning(
278                " Continuing initialization despite Docker consistency check failure"
279            )
280
281        try:
282            # Create model using the model manager
283            model = self.model_manager.create_model()
284            logger.info("Created model: %s", self.model_name)
285
286            # Prepare tools list
287            tools = [
288                # Add GoogleSearch tools directly for web search functionality
289                GoogleSearchTools(),
290                YFinanceTools(
291                    stock_price=True,
292                    company_info=True,
293                    stock_fundamentals=True,
294                    key_financial_ratios=True,
295                    analyst_recommendations=True,
296                ),
297                PythonTools(),
298                ShellTools(
299                    base_dir="."
300                ),  # Match Streamlit configuration for consistency
301                PersonalAgentFilesystemTools(),
302                # Removed PersonalAgentWebTools as it was causing confusion with MCP references
303            ]
304
305            # Initialize Agno native storage and knowledge following the working example pattern
306            if self.enable_memory:
307                self.agno_storage = create_agno_storage(self.storage_dir)
308                logger.info("Created Agno storage at: %s", self.storage_dir)
309
310                # Create knowledge base (sync creation)
311                self.agno_knowledge = create_combined_knowledge_base(
312                    self.storage_dir, self.knowledge_dir, self.agno_storage
313                )
314
315                # Load knowledge base content (async loading) - matches working example
316                if self.agno_knowledge:
317                    await load_combined_knowledge_base(
318                        self.agno_knowledge, recreate=recreate
319                    )
320                    logger.info("Loaded Agno combined knowledge base content")
321
322                # Create memory with SemanticMemoryManager (debug mode passed through)
323                self.agno_memory = create_agno_memory(
324                    self.storage_dir, debug_mode=self.debug
325                )
326
327                if self.agno_memory:
328                    # Initialize the memory manager with the created agno_memory
329                    self.memory_manager.initialize(self.agno_memory)
330                    logger.info(
331                        "Created Agno memory with SemanticMemoryManager at: %s",
332                        self.storage_dir,
333                    )
334                else:
335                    logger.error("Failed to create memory system")
336
337                # Add Lightrag knowledge if enabled
338                if self.enable_memory:
339                    try:
340                        self.lightrag_knowledge = await load_lightrag_knowledge_base()
341                        self.lightrag_knowledge_enabled = (
342                            self.lightrag_knowledge is not None
343                        )
344                        logger.info("Loaded Lightrag knowledge base metadata")
345                    except Exception as e:
346                        logger.warning("Failed to load Lightrag knowledge base: %s", e)
347                        self.lightrag_knowledge = None
348                        self.lightrag_knowledge_enabled = False
349
350                # Create Knowledge Coordinator
351                self.knowledge_coordinator = create_knowledge_coordinator(
352                    agno_knowledge=self.agno_knowledge,
353                    lightrag_url=LIGHTRAG_URL,
354                    debug=self.debug,
355                )
356                logger.info(
357                    "Created Knowledge Coordinator for unified knowledge queries"
358                )
359
360                # If recreate is True, clear all memories AFTER memory system is initialized
361                if recreate and self.enable_memory:
362                    logger.info(
363                        "Recreate flag is True, clearing all memories after memory system initialization"
364                    )
365                    clear_result = await self.memory_manager.clear_all_memories()
366                    logger.info("Memory clear result: %s", clear_result)
367
368                logger.info("Initialized Agno storage and knowledge backend")
369            else:
370                logger.info(
371                    "Memory disabled, skipping storage and knowledge initialization"
372                )
373
374            # Get MCP tools as function wrappers (no pre-initialization)
375            mcp_tool_functions = []
376            if self.enable_mcp:
377                mcp_tool_functions = await self._get_mcp_tools()
378                tools.extend(mcp_tool_functions)
379                logger.info("Added %d MCP tools to agent", len(mcp_tool_functions))
380
381            # Get memory tools from the memory manager
382            memory_tool_functions = []
383            if self.enable_memory:
384                memory_tool_functions = await self.memory_manager.get_memory_tools()
385                tools.extend(memory_tool_functions)
386                logger.info(
387                    "Added %d memory tools to agent", len(memory_tool_functions)
388                )
389
390            # Create the agno agent with direct parameter passing for visibility
391            self.agent = Agent(
392                model=model,
393                tools=tools,
394                instructions=self.instruction_manager.create_instructions(),
395                markdown=True,
396                show_tool_calls=self.debug,
397                name="Personal AI Agent",
398                agent_id="personal_agent",
399                user_id=self.user_id,
400                enable_agentic_memory=False,  # Disable agno's native memory to use our custom memory system
401                enable_user_memories=True,  # Re-enable agno's native memory to allow user retrieval
402                add_history_to_messages=True,  # Add conversation history to context
403                num_history_responses=3,
404                knowledge=self.agno_knowledge if self.enable_memory else None,
405                search_knowledge=(
406                    True if self.enable_memory and self.agno_knowledge else False
407                ),  # Enable automatic knowledge search
408                storage=self.agno_storage if self.enable_memory else None,
409                memory=self.agno_memory if self.enable_memory else None,  # Pass our custom memory system to prevent "MemoryDb not provided" warnings
410                # Enable telemetry and verbose logging
411                debug_mode=self.debug,
412                # Enable streaming for intermediate steps
413                stream_intermediate_steps=True,  # Required for aprint_response to work correctly
414            )
415
416            if self.enable_memory and self.agno_knowledge:
417                logger.info("Agent configured with knowledge base search")
418
419            # Calculate tool counts for logging using already-created tool lists
420            mcp_tool_count = len(mcp_tool_functions)
421            memory_tool_count = len(memory_tool_functions)
422
423            logger.info(
424                "Successfully initialized agno agent with native storage: %d total tools (%d MCP, %d memory)",
425                len(tools),
426                mcp_tool_count,
427                memory_tool_count,
428            )
429
430            # Display splash screen if enabled
431            if SHOW_SPLASH_SCREEN:
432                import importlib.metadata
433
434                agent_info = self.get_agent_info()
435                agent_version = importlib.metadata.version("personal-agent")
436                display_splash_screen(agent_info, agent_version)
437
438            return True
439
440        except Exception as e:
441            logger.error("Failed to initialize agno agent: %s", e)
442            return False
443
444    async def run(
445        self, query: str, stream: bool = False, add_thought_callback=None
446    ) -> Union[str, Dict[str, Any]]:
447        """Run a query through the agno agent, allowing for native tool execution.
448
449        Args:
450            query: User query to process
451            stream: Whether to stream the response
452            add_thought_callback: Optional callback for adding thoughts during processing
453
454        Returns:
455            Agent's final string response or response dictionary
456
457        Raises:
458            RuntimeError: If agent is not initialized
459        """
460        if not self.agent:
461            raise RuntimeError("Agent not initialized. Call initialize() first.")
462
463        try:
464            if add_thought_callback:
465                add_thought_callback(" Executing agno agent...")
466
467            # The agent will handle the full tool-use loop internally
468            response = await self.agent.arun(query, user_id=self.user_id)
469            self._last_response = response  # Store for tool call inspection
470
471            # Use tool_manager to analyze tool calls if needed
472            if hasattr(response, "tool_calls") and response.tool_calls:
473                logger.debug(
474                    f"Agent used {len(response.tool_calls)} tools in this response"
475                )
476                # We could use tool_manager here for additional tool analysis if needed
477
478            if add_thought_callback:
479                add_thought_callback(" Agent execution complete.")
480
481            return response.content
482
483        except Exception as e:
484            logger.error("Error running agno agent: %s", e)
485            if add_thought_callback:
486                add_thought_callback(f" Error: {str(e)}")
487            return f"Error processing request: {str(e)}"
488
489    async def store_user_memory(
490        self, content: str = "", topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None
491    ) -> MemoryStorageResult:
492        """Store information as a user memory in both local SQLite and LightRAG graph systems.
493
494        This is a public method that delegates to the memory_manager.
495
496        Args:
497            content: The information to store as a memory
498            topics: Optional list of topics/categories for the memory (None = auto-classify)
499
500        Returns:
501            MemoryStorageResult: Structured result with detailed status information
502        """
503        return await self.memory_manager.store_user_memory(content, topics)
504
505    async def _restate_user_fact(self, content: str) -> str:
506        """Restate a user fact from first-person to third-person.
507
508        Delegates to the memory_manager for processing.
509
510        Args:
511            content: The original fact from the user
512
513        Returns:
514            The restated fact
515        """
516        return self.memory_manager.restate_user_fact(content)
517
518    async def seed_entity_in_graph(self, entity_name: str, entity_type: str) -> bool:
519        """Seed an entity into the graph by creating and uploading a physical file.
520
521        Delegates to the memory_manager for processing.
522
523        Args:
524            entity_name: Name of the entity to create
525            entity_type: Type of the entity
526
527        Returns:
528            True if entity was successfully seeded
529        """
530        return await self.memory_manager.seed_entity_in_graph(entity_name, entity_type)
531
532    async def check_entity_exists(self, entity_name: str) -> bool:
533        """Check if entity exists in the graph.
534
535        Delegates to the memory_manager for processing.
536
537        Args:
538            entity_name: Name of the entity to check
539
540        Returns:
541            True if entity exists
542        """
543        return await self.memory_manager.check_entity_exists(entity_name)
544
545    async def clear_all_memories(self) -> str:
546        """Clear all memories from both SQLite and LightRAG systems.
547
548        Delegates to the memory_manager for processing.
549
550        Returns:
551            str: Success or error message
552        """
553        return await self.memory_manager.clear_all_memories()
554
555    async def query_lightrag_knowledge_direct(self, query: str, params: dict) -> str:
556        """Directly query the LightRAG knowledge base and return the raw response.
557
558        Delegates to the knowledge_manager for processing.
559
560        Args:
561            query: The query string to search in the knowledge base
562            params: A dictionary of query parameters
563
564        Returns:
565            String with query results exactly as LightRAG returns them
566        """
567        return await self.knowledge_manager.query_graph(query)
568
569    async def _get_mcp_tools(self) -> List:
570        """Create MCP tools as native async functions compatible with Agno.
571
572        Returns:
573            List of MCP tool functions
574        """
575        logger.info(
576            "_get_mcp_tools called - enable_mcp: %s, mcp_servers: %s",
577            self.enable_mcp,
578            self.mcp_servers,
579        )
580
581        if not self.enable_mcp:
582            logger.info("MCP disabled - enable_mcp is False")
583            return []
584
585        if not self.mcp_servers:
586            logger.info(
587                "No MCP servers configured - mcp_servers is empty: %s", self.mcp_servers
588            )
589            return []
590
591        # This method is complex and specific to MCP integration
592        # For now, we'll keep the original implementation
593        # In the future, this could be moved to the tool_manager
594        tools = []
595
596        for server_name, config in self.mcp_servers.items():
597            logger.info("Setting up MCP tool for server: %s", server_name)
598
599            command = config.get("command", "npx")
600            args = config.get("args", [])
601            env = config.get("env", {})
602            description = config.get(
603                "description", f"Access to {server_name} MCP server"
604            )
605
606            # Create the actual tool function with closure
607            def make_mcp_tool(
608                name: str,
609                cmd: str,
610                tool_args: List[str],
611                tool_env: Dict[str, str],
612                desc: str,
613            ) -> Any:
614                """Create MCP tool function with proper closure."""
615
616                from textwrap import dedent
617
618                from agno.tools.mcp import MCPTools
619                from mcp import ClientSession, StdioServerParameters
620                from mcp.client.stdio import stdio_client
621
622                async def mcp_tool(query: str) -> str:
623                    """MCP tool function that creates session on-demand."""
624                    try:
625                        # Prepare environment - convert GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN to GITHUB_TOKEN if needed
626                        server_env = tool_env.copy() if tool_env else {}
627                        if (
628                            name == "github"
629                            and "GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN" in server_env
630                        ):
631                            # The GitHub MCP server expects GITHUB_TOKEN
632                            server_env["GITHUB_TOKEN"] = server_env[
633                                "GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN"
634                            ]
635                            logger.info(
636                                "Converted GITHUB_PERSONAL_ACCESS_TOKEN to GITHUB_TOKEN for GitHub MCP server"
637                            )
638
639                        server_params = StdioServerParameters(
640                            command=cmd,
641                            args=tool_args,
642                            env=server_env,
643                        )
644
645                        # Create client session using async context manager
646                        async with stdio_client(server_params) as (read, write):
647                            async with ClientSession(read, write) as session:
648                                # Initialize MCP toolkit with session
649                                mcp_tools = MCPTools(session=session)
650                                await mcp_tools.initialize()
651
652                                # Create specialized instructions based on server type
653                                if name == "github":
654                                    instructions = dedent(
655                                        """\
656                                        You are a GitHub assistant. Help users explore repositories and their activity.
657                                        - Provide organized, concise insights about the repository
658                                        - Focus on facts and data from the GitHub API
659                                        - Use markdown formatting for better readability
660                                        - Present numerical data in tables when appropriate
661                                        - Include links to relevant GitHub pages when helpful
662                                    """
663                                    )
664                                elif name.startswith("filesystem"):
665                                    instructions = f"You are a filesystem assistant for {name}. Help with file and directory operations."
666                                elif name == "brave-search":
667                                    instructions = "You are a web search assistant. Help users find information on the web."
668                                elif name == "puppeteer":
669                                    instructions = "You are a browser automation assistant. Help with web scraping and automation tasks."
670                                else:
671                                    instructions = f"You are an assistant using {name} MCP server. Help with the user's request."
672
673                                # Create a temporary agent for this MCP server
674                                temp_agent = Agent(
675                                    model=self.model_manager.create_model(),
676                                    tools=[mcp_tools],
677                                    instructions=instructions,
678                                    markdown=True,
679                                    show_tool_calls=self.debug,
680                                )
681
682                                # Run the query
683                                response = await temp_agent.arun(query)
684                                return response.content
685
686                    except Exception as e:
687                        logger.error("Error running %s MCP server: %s", name, e)
688                        return f"Error using {name}: {str(e)}"
689
690                # Set function metadata
691                mcp_tool.__name__ = f"use_{name.replace('-', '_')}_server"
692                mcp_tool.__doc__ = f"""Use {name} MCP server for: {desc}
693
694Args:
695    query: The query or task to execute using {name}
696
697Returns:
698    str: Result from the MCP server
699"""
700
701                return mcp_tool
702
703            tool_func = make_mcp_tool(server_name, command, args, env, description)
704            tools.append(tool_func)
705            logger.info("Created MCP tool function for: %s", server_name)
706
707        return tools
708
709    def get_agent_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
710        """Get comprehensive information about the agent configuration and tools.
711
712        Returns:
713            Dictionary containing detailed agent configuration and tool information
714        """
715        # Get basic tool info
716        built_in_tools = []
717        mcp_tools = []
718
719        if self.agent and hasattr(self.agent, "tools"):
720            for tool in self.agent.tools:
721                tool_name = getattr(tool, "__name__", str(type(tool).__name__))
722                tool_doc = getattr(tool, "__doc__", "No description available")
723
724                # Clean up docstring for display
725                if tool_doc:
726                    tool_doc = tool_doc.strip().split("\n")[0]  # First line only
727
728                if tool_name.startswith("use_") and "_server" in tool_name:
729                    mcp_tools.append(
730                        {
731                            "name": tool_name,
732                            "description": tool_doc,
733                            "type": "MCP Server",
734                        }
735                    )
736                else:
737                    built_in_tools.append(
738                        {
739                            "name": tool_name,
740                            "description": tool_doc,
741                            "type": "Built-in Tool",
742                        }
743                    )
744
745        # MCP server details
746        mcp_server_details = {}
747        if self.enable_mcp and self.mcp_servers:
748            for server_name, config in self.mcp_servers.items():
749                mcp_server_details[server_name] = {
750                    "command": config.get("command", "N/A"),
751                    "description": config.get(
752                        "description", f"Access to {server_name} MCP server"
753                    ),
754                    "args_count": len(config.get("args", [])),
755                    "env_vars": len(config.get("env", {})),
756                }
757
758        return {
759            "framework": "agno",
760            "model_provider": self.model_provider,
761            "model_name": self.model_name,
762            "memory_enabled": self.enable_memory,
763            "knowledge_enabled": self.agno_knowledge is not None,
764            "lightrag_knowledge_enabled": self.lightrag_knowledge_enabled,
765            "mcp_enabled": self.enable_mcp,
766            "debug_mode": self.debug,
767            "user_id": self.user_id,
768            "initialized": self.agent is not None,
769            "storage_dir": self.storage_dir,
770            "knowledge_dir": self.knowledge_dir,
771            "lightrag_url": LIGHTRAG_URL,
772            "lightrag_memory_url": LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_URL,
773            "tool_counts": {
774                "total": len(built_in_tools) + len(mcp_tools),
775                "built_in": len(built_in_tools),
776                "mcp": len(mcp_tools),
777                "mcp_servers": len(self.mcp_servers) if self.enable_mcp else 0,
778            },
779            "built_in_tools": built_in_tools,
780            "mcp_tools": mcp_tools,
781            "mcp_servers": mcp_server_details,
782        }
783
784    def print_agent_info(self, console: Optional[Console] = None) -> None:
785        """Pretty print comprehensive agent information using Rich.
786
787        Args:
788            console: Optional Rich Console instance. If None, creates a new one.
789        """
790        if console is None:
791            console = Console()
792
793        info = self.get_agent_info()
794
795        # Main agent info table
796        main_table = Table(
797            title=" Personal AI Agent Configuration",
798            show_header=True,
799            header_style="bold magenta",
800        )
801        main_table.add_column("Setting", style="cyan", no_wrap=True)
802        main_table.add_column("Value", style="green")
803
804        main_table.add_row("Framework", info["framework"])
805        main_table.add_row("Model Provider", f"{info['model_provider']}")
806        main_table.add_row("Model Name", info["model_name"])
807        main_table.add_row("Memory Enabled", str(info["memory_enabled"]))
808        main_table.add_row("Knowledge Enabled", str(info["knowledge_enabled"]))
809        main_table.add_row(
810            "LightRAG Knowledge", str(info["lightrag_knowledge_enabled"])
811        )
812        main_table.add_row("MCP Enabled", str(info["mcp_enabled"]))
813        main_table.add_row("Debug Mode", str(info["debug_mode"]))
814        main_table.add_row("User ID", info["user_id"])
815        main_table.add_row("Storage Directory", info["storage_dir"])
816        main_table.add_row("Knowledge Directory", info["knowledge_dir"])
817        main_table.add_row("Total Tools", str(info["tool_counts"]["total"]))
818
819        console.print(main_table)
820
821        # Tools table
822        tools_table = Table(
823            title=" Available Tools",
824            show_header=True,
825            header_style="bold magenta",
826        )
827        tools_table.add_column("Name", style="cyan")
828        tools_table.add_column("Type", style="yellow")
829        tools_table.add_column("Description", style="green")
830
831        # Add built-in tools
832        for tool in info["built_in_tools"]:
833            tools_table.add_row(
834                tool["name"], tool["type"], tool.get("description", "No description")
835            )
836
837        # Add MCP tools
838        for tool in info["mcp_tools"]:
839            tools_table.add_row(
840                tool["name"], tool["type"], tool.get("description", "No description")
841            )
842
843        console.print(tools_table)
844
845        # MCP servers table if enabled
846        if info["mcp_enabled"] and info["mcp_servers"]:
847            mcp_table = Table(
848                title=" MCP Servers",
849                show_header=True,
850                header_style="bold magenta",
851            )
852            mcp_table.add_column("Server Name", style="cyan")
853            mcp_table.add_column("Command", style="yellow")
854            mcp_table.add_column("Description", style="green")
855            mcp_table.add_column("Args Count", style="blue")
856            mcp_table.add_column("Env Vars", style="blue")
857
858            for server_name, server_info in info["mcp_servers"].items():
859                mcp_table.add_row(
860                    server_name,
861                    server_info["command"],
862                    server_info["description"],
863                    str(server_info["args_count"]),
864                    str(server_info["env_vars"]),
865                )
866
867            console.print(mcp_table)
868
869    async def cleanup(self) -> None:
870        """Clean up resources when the agent is being shut down.
871        
872        This method is called during application shutdown to properly
873        clean up any resources, connections, or background tasks.
874        """
875        try:
876            logger.info("Cleaning up AgnoPersonalAgent resources...")
877            
878            # Clean up agent resources
879            if self.agent:
880                # Clear the agent reference
881                self.agent = None
882                logger.debug("Cleared agent reference")
883            
884            # Clean up storage references
885            if self.agno_storage:
886                self.agno_storage = None
887                logger.debug("Cleared storage reference")
888                
889            if self.agno_knowledge:
890                self.agno_knowledge = None
891                logger.debug("Cleared knowledge reference")
892                
893            if self.agno_memory:
894                self.agno_memory = None
895                logger.debug("Cleared memory reference")
896                
897            if self.knowledge_coordinator:
898                self.knowledge_coordinator = None
899                logger.debug("Cleared knowledge coordinator reference")
900            
901            # Clean up manager references safely
902            if self.model_manager:
903                self.model_manager = None
904                logger.debug("Cleared model manager reference")
905                
906            if self.instruction_manager:
907                self.instruction_manager = None
908                logger.debug("Cleared instruction manager reference")
909                
910            if self.memory_manager:
911                self.memory_manager = None
912                logger.debug("Cleared memory manager reference")
913                
914            if self.knowledge_manager:
915                self.knowledge_manager = None
916                logger.debug("Cleared knowledge manager reference")
917                
918            if self.tool_manager:
919                self.tool_manager = None
920                logger.debug("Cleared tool manager reference")
921            
922            logger.info("AgnoPersonalAgent cleanup completed successfully")
923            
924        except Exception as e:
925            logger.warning("Error during AgnoPersonalAgent cleanup: %s", e)
926    
927    def sync_cleanup(self) -> None:
928        """Synchronous cleanup method for compatibility.
929        
930        This method provides a synchronous interface to cleanup for cases
931        where async cleanup cannot be used.
932        """
933        try:
934            logger.info("Running synchronous cleanup...")
935            
936            # Clean up agent resources without async calls
937            if self.agent:
938                self.agent = None
939                logger.debug("Cleared agent reference")
940            
941            # Clean up storage references
942            if self.agno_storage:
943                self.agno_storage = None
944                logger.debug("Cleared storage reference")
945                
946            if self.agno_knowledge:
947                self.agno_knowledge = None
948                logger.debug("Cleared knowledge reference")
949                
950            if self.agno_memory:
951                self.agno_memory = None
952                logger.debug("Cleared memory reference")
953                
954            if self.knowledge_coordinator:
955                self.knowledge_coordinator = None
956                logger.debug("Cleared knowledge coordinator reference")
957            
958            # Clean up manager references
959            self.model_manager = None
960            self.instruction_manager = None
961            self.memory_manager = None
962            self.knowledge_manager = None
963            self.tool_manager = None
964            
965            logger.info("Synchronous cleanup completed successfully")
966            
967        except Exception as e:
968            logger.warning("Error during synchronous cleanup: %s", e)

Refactored Agno-based Personal AI Agent with MCP integration and native storage.

This class coordinates the different components of the agent system, delegating specific responsibilities to specialized manager classes.

AgnoPersonalAgent( model_provider: str = 'ollama', model_name: str = 'qwen3:1.7b', enable_memory: bool = True, enable_mcp: bool = True, storage_dir: str = '/Users/Shared/personal_agent_data/agno/Eric', knowledge_dir: str = '/Users/Shared/personal_agent_data/agno/Eric/knowledge', debug: bool = False, ollama_base_url: str = 'http://tesla.local:11434', user_id: str = 'Eric', recreate: bool = False, instruction_level: personal_agent.core.agent_instruction_manager.InstructionLevel = <InstructionLevel.STANDARD: 3>, seed: Optional[int] = None) 
 76    def __init__(
 77        self,
 78        model_provider: str = "ollama",
 79        model_name: str = LLM_MODEL,
 80        enable_memory: bool = True,
 81        enable_mcp: bool = True,
 82        storage_dir: str = AGNO_STORAGE_DIR,
 83        knowledge_dir: str = AGNO_KNOWLEDGE_DIR,
 84        debug: bool = False,
 85        ollama_base_url: str = OLLAMA_URL,
 86        user_id: str = USER_ID,
 87        recreate: bool = False,
 88        instruction_level: InstructionLevel = InstructionLevel.STANDARD,
 89        seed: Optional[int] = None,
 90    ) -> None:
 91        """Initialize the Agno Personal Agent.
 92
 93        Args:
 94            model_provider: LLM provider ('ollama' or 'openai')
 95            model_name: Model name to use
 96            enable_memory: Whether to enable memory and knowledge features
 97            enable_mcp: Whether to enable MCP tool integration
 98            storage_dir: Directory for Agno storage files
 99            knowledge_dir: Directory containing knowledge files to load
100            debug: Enable debug logging and tool call visibility
101            ollama_base_url: Base URL for Ollama API
102            user_id: User identifier for memory operations
103            recreate: Whether to recreate knowledge bases
104            instruction_level: The sophistication level for agent instructions
105            seed: Optional seed for model reproducibility
106        """
107        # Basic configuration
108        self.model_provider = model_provider
109        self.model_name = model_name
110        self.enable_memory = enable_memory
111        self.enable_mcp = enable_mcp and USE_MCP
112        self.debug = debug
113        self.ollama_base_url = ollama_base_url
114        self.user_id = user_id
115        self.recreate = recreate
116        self.instruction_level = instruction_level
117        self.seed = seed
118
119        # Set up storage paths
120        self._setup_storage_paths(storage_dir, knowledge_dir, user_id)
121
122        # MCP configuration
123        self.mcp_servers = get_mcp_servers() if self.enable_mcp else {}
124
125        # Initialize component managers
126        self.model_manager: AgentModelManager = AgentModelManager(
127            model_provider, model_name, ollama_base_url, seed
128        )
129
130        self.instruction_manager: AgentInstructionManager = AgentInstructionManager(
131            instruction_level, user_id, enable_memory, self.enable_mcp, self.mcp_servers
132        )
133
134        self.memory_manager: AgentMemoryManager = AgentMemoryManager(
135            user_id,
136            self.storage_dir,
137            None,  # agno_memory will be set during initialization
138            LIGHTRAG_URL,
139            LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_URL,
140            enable_memory,
141        )
142
143        self.knowledge_manager: AgentKnowledgeManager = AgentKnowledgeManager(
144            user_id, self.storage_dir, LIGHTRAG_URL, LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_URL
145        )
146
147        self.tool_manager: AgentToolManager = AgentToolManager(
148            user_id, self.storage_dir
149        )
150
151        # Storage components
152        self.agno_storage = None
153        self.agno_knowledge = None
154        self.lightrag_knowledge = None
155        self.lightrag_knowledge_enabled = False
156        self.agno_memory = None
157        self.knowledge_coordinator = None
158
159        # Agent instance
160        self.agent = None
161        self._last_response = None
162
163        logger.info(
164            "Initialized AgnoPersonalAgent with model=%s, memory=%s, mcp=%s, user_id=%s",
165            f"{model_provider}:{model_name}",
166            self.enable_memory,
167            self.enable_mcp,
168            self.user_id,
169        )

Initialize the Agno Personal Agent.

Args: model_provider: LLM provider ('ollama' or 'openai') model_name: Model name to use enable_memory: Whether to enable memory and knowledge features enable_mcp: Whether to enable MCP tool integration storage_dir: Directory for Agno storage files knowledge_dir: Directory containing knowledge files to load debug: Enable debug logging and tool call visibility ollama_base_url: Base URL for Ollama API user_id: User identifier for memory operations recreate: Whether to recreate knowledge bases instruction_level: The sophistication level for agent instructions seed: Optional seed for model reproducibility
