model_name
enable_memory
enable_mcp
debug
ollama_base_url
user_id
recreate
instruction_level
seed
mcp_servers
model_manager: AgentModelManager
instruction_manager: AgentInstructionManager
memory_manager: AgentMemoryManager
knowledge_manager: AgentKnowledgeManager
tool_manager: AgentToolManager
agno_storage
agno_knowledge
lightrag_knowledge
lightrag_knowledge_enabled
agno_memory
knowledge_coordinator
agent
async def initialize(self, recreate: bool = False) -> bool: 
194    async def initialize(self, recreate: bool = False) -> bool:
195        """Initialize the agno agent with all components.
196
197        Args:
198            recreate: Whether to recreate the agent knowledge bases
199
200        Returns:
201            True if initialization successful, False otherwise
202        """
203        logger.info(
204            " AgnoPersonalAgent.initialize() called with recreate=%s", recreate
205        )
206
207        # CRITICAL: Synchronize the agent's user_id with the persistent user setting
208        try:
209            from ..config import get_current_user_id
210            from .user_manager import UserManager
211
212            user_manager = UserManager()
213            persistent_user_id = (
214                get_current_user_id()
215            )  # This is loaded from env.userid at startup
216
217            if self.user_id != persistent_user_id:
218                logger.warning(
219                    "Agent initialized with user '%s', but persistent user is '%s'. Switching context...",
220                    self.user_id,
221                    persistent_user_id,
222                )
223                # This is a formal user switch. Update the persistent user file.
224                switch_result = user_manager.switch_user(
225                    self.user_id, restart_lightrag=True, update_global_config=True
226                )
227                if not switch_result.get(
228                    "success"
229                ) and "Already logged in" not in switch_result.get("error", ""):
230                    raise RuntimeError(
231                        f"Failed to switch user context to '{self.user_id}': {switch_result.get('error')}"
232                    )
233                else:
234                    logger.info(
235                        "Successfully switched user context to '%s'", self.user_id
236                    )
237
238        except Exception as e:
239            logger.error(" Critical error during user context synchronization: %s", e)
240            # This is a critical step, so we raise an exception if it fails.
241            raise RuntimeError(f"User context synchronization failed: {e}") from e
242
243        # CRITICAL: Ensure user is registered in the user registry
244        logger.info(" Ensuring user %s is registered in user registry", self.user_id)
245        try:
246            from .user_registry import UserRegistry
247
248            user_registry = UserRegistry()
249            user_registry.ensure_current_user_registered()
250            logger.info(" User registration check completed")
251        except Exception as e:
252            logger.warning(" User registry check failed: %s", e)
253            # Don't fail initialization for user registry issues
254
255        # CRITICAL: Ensure Docker USER_ID consistency with smart restart capability
256        logger.info(" Checking Docker USER_ID consistency for user: %s", self.user_id)
257        try:
258            ready_to_proceed, consistency_message = ensure_docker_user_consistency(
259                user_id=self.user_id, auto_fix=True, force_restart=False  # Only restart if actually needed
260            )
261
262            if ready_to_proceed:
263                logger.info(
264                    " Docker consistency check passed: %s", consistency_message
265                )
266            else:
267                logger.error(
268                    " Docker consistency check failed: %s", consistency_message
269                )
270                raise RuntimeError(
271                    f"Docker USER_ID consistency check failed: {consistency_message}"
272                )
273
274        except Exception as e:
275            logger.error(" Critical error during Docker consistency check: %s", e)
276            # Don't fail initialization for Docker consistency issues in case Docker is not available
277            logger.warning(
278                " Continuing initialization despite Docker consistency check failure"
279            )
280
281        try:
282            # Create model using the model manager
283            model = self.model_manager.create_model()
284            logger.info("Created model: %s", self.model_name)
285
286            # Prepare tools list
287            tools = [
288                # Add GoogleSearch tools directly for web search functionality
289                GoogleSearchTools(),
290                YFinanceTools(
291                    stock_price=True,
292                    company_info=True,
293                    stock_fundamentals=True,
294                    key_financial_ratios=True,
295                    analyst_recommendations=True,
296                ),
297                PythonTools(),
298                ShellTools(
299                    base_dir="."
300                ),  # Match Streamlit configuration for consistency
301                PersonalAgentFilesystemTools(),
302                # Removed PersonalAgentWebTools as it was causing confusion with MCP references
303            ]
304
305            # Initialize Agno native storage and knowledge following the working example pattern
306            if self.enable_memory:
307                self.agno_storage = create_agno_storage(self.storage_dir)
308                logger.info("Created Agno storage at: %s", self.storage_dir)
309
310                # Create knowledge base (sync creation)
311                self.agno_knowledge = create_combined_knowledge_base(
312                    self.storage_dir, self.knowledge_dir, self.agno_storage
313                )
314
315                # Load knowledge base content (async loading) - matches working example
316                if self.agno_knowledge:
317                    await load_combined_knowledge_base(
318                        self.agno_knowledge, recreate=recreate
319                    )
320                    logger.info("Loaded Agno combined knowledge base content")
321
322                # Create memory with SemanticMemoryManager (debug mode passed through)
323                self.agno_memory = create_agno_memory(
324                    self.storage_dir, debug_mode=self.debug
325                )
326
327                if self.agno_memory:
328                    # Initialize the memory manager with the created agno_memory
329                    self.memory_manager.initialize(self.agno_memory)
330                    logger.info(
331                        "Created Agno memory with SemanticMemoryManager at: %s",
332                        self.storage_dir,
333                    )
334                else:
335                    logger.error("Failed to create memory system")
336
337                # Add Lightrag knowledge if enabled
338                if self.enable_memory:
339                    try:
340                        self.lightrag_knowledge = await load_lightrag_knowledge_base()
341                        self.lightrag_knowledge_enabled = (
342                            self.lightrag_knowledge is not None
343                        )
344                        logger.info("Loaded Lightrag knowledge base metadata")
345                    except Exception as e:
346                        logger.warning("Failed to load Lightrag knowledge base: %s", e)
347                        self.lightrag_knowledge = None
348                        self.lightrag_knowledge_enabled = False
349
350                # Create Knowledge Coordinator
351                self.knowledge_coordinator = create_knowledge_coordinator(
352                    agno_knowledge=self.agno_knowledge,
353                    lightrag_url=LIGHTRAG_URL,
354                    debug=self.debug,
355                )
356                logger.info(
357                    "Created Knowledge Coordinator for unified knowledge queries"
358                )
359
360                # If recreate is True, clear all memories AFTER memory system is initialized
361                if recreate and self.enable_memory:
362                    logger.info(
363                        "Recreate flag is True, clearing all memories after memory system initialization"
364                    )
365                    clear_result = await self.memory_manager.clear_all_memories()
366                    logger.info("Memory clear result: %s", clear_result)
367
368                logger.info("Initialized Agno storage and knowledge backend")
369            else:
370                logger.info(
371                    "Memory disabled, skipping storage and knowledge initialization"
372                )
373
374            # Get MCP tools as function wrappers (no pre-initialization)
375            mcp_tool_functions = []
376            if self.enable_mcp:
377                mcp_tool_functions = await self._get_mcp_tools()
378                tools.extend(mcp_tool_functions)
379                logger.info("Added %d MCP tools to agent", len(mcp_tool_functions))
380
381            # Get memory tools from the memory manager
382            memory_tool_functions = []
383            if self.enable_memory:
384                memory_tool_functions = await self.memory_manager.get_memory_tools()
385                tools.extend(memory_tool_functions)
386                logger.info(
387                    "Added %d memory tools to agent", len(memory_tool_functions)
388                )
389
390            # Create the agno agent with direct parameter passing for visibility
391            self.agent = Agent(
392                model=model,
393                tools=tools,
394                instructions=self.instruction_manager.create_instructions(),
395                markdown=True,
396                show_tool_calls=self.debug,
397                name="Personal AI Agent",
398                agent_id="personal_agent",
399                user_id=self.user_id,
400                enable_agentic_memory=False,  # Disable agno's native memory to use our custom memory system
401                enable_user_memories=True,  # Re-enable agno's native memory to allow user retrieval
402                add_history_to_messages=True,  # Add conversation history to context
403                num_history_responses=3,
404                knowledge=self.agno_knowledge if self.enable_memory else None,
405                search_knowledge=(
406                    True if self.enable_memory and self.agno_knowledge else False
407                ),  # Enable automatic knowledge search
408                storage=self.agno_storage if self.enable_memory else None,
409                memory=self.agno_memory if self.enable_memory else None,  # Pass our custom memory system to prevent "MemoryDb not provided" warnings
410                # Enable telemetry and verbose logging
411                debug_mode=self.debug,
412                # Enable streaming for intermediate steps
413                stream_intermediate_steps=True,  # Required for aprint_response to work correctly
414            )
415
416            if self.enable_memory and self.agno_knowledge:
417                logger.info("Agent configured with knowledge base search")
418
419            # Calculate tool counts for logging using already-created tool lists
420            mcp_tool_count = len(mcp_tool_functions)
421            memory_tool_count = len(memory_tool_functions)
422
423            logger.info(
424                "Successfully initialized agno agent with native storage: %d total tools (%d MCP, %d memory)",
425                len(tools),
426                mcp_tool_count,
427                memory_tool_count,
428            )
429
430            # Display splash screen if enabled
431            if SHOW_SPLASH_SCREEN:
432                import importlib.metadata
433
434                agent_info = self.get_agent_info()
435                agent_version = importlib.metadata.version("personal-agent")
436                display_splash_screen(agent_info, agent_version)
437
438            return True
439
440        except Exception as e:
441            logger.error("Failed to initialize agno agent: %s", e)
442            return False

Initialize the agno agent with all components.

Args: recreate: Whether to recreate the agent knowledge bases

Returns: True if initialization successful, False otherwise

async def run( self, query: str, stream: bool = False, add_thought_callback=None) -> Union[str, Dict[str, Any]]: 
444    async def run(
445        self, query: str, stream: bool = False, add_thought_callback=None
446    ) -> Union[str, Dict[str, Any]]:
447        """Run a query through the agno agent, allowing for native tool execution.
448
449        Args:
450            query: User query to process
451            stream: Whether to stream the response
452            add_thought_callback: Optional callback for adding thoughts during processing
453
454        Returns:
455            Agent's final string response or response dictionary
456
457        Raises:
458            RuntimeError: If agent is not initialized
459        """
460        if not self.agent:
461            raise RuntimeError("Agent not initialized. Call initialize() first.")
462
463        try:
464            if add_thought_callback:
465                add_thought_callback(" Executing agno agent...")
466
467            # The agent will handle the full tool-use loop internally
468            response = await self.agent.arun(query, user_id=self.user_id)
469            self._last_response = response  # Store for tool call inspection
470
471            # Use tool_manager to analyze tool calls if needed
472            if hasattr(response, "tool_calls") and response.tool_calls:
473                logger.debug(
474                    f"Agent used {len(response.tool_calls)} tools in this response"
475                )
476                # We could use tool_manager here for additional tool analysis if needed
477
478            if add_thought_callback:
479                add_thought_callback(" Agent execution complete.")
480
481            return response.content
482
483        except Exception as e:
484            logger.error("Error running agno agent: %s", e)
485            if add_thought_callback:
486                add_thought_callback(f" Error: {str(e)}")
487            return f"Error processing request: {str(e)}"

Run a query through the agno agent, allowing for native tool execution.

Args: query: User query to process stream: Whether to stream the response add_thought_callback: Optional callback for adding thoughts during processing

Returns: Agent's final string response or response dictionary

Raises: RuntimeError: If agent is not initialized

async def store_user_memory( self, content: str = '', topics: Union[List[str], str, NoneType] = None) -> MemoryStorageResult: 
489    async def store_user_memory(
490        self, content: str = "", topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None
491    ) -> MemoryStorageResult:
492        """Store information as a user memory in both local SQLite and LightRAG graph systems.
493
494        This is a public method that delegates to the memory_manager.
495
496        Args:
497            content: The information to store as a memory
498            topics: Optional list of topics/categories for the memory (None = auto-classify)
499
500        Returns:
501            MemoryStorageResult: Structured result with detailed status information
502        """
503        return await self.memory_manager.store_user_memory(content, topics)

Store information as a user memory in both local SQLite and LightRAG graph systems.

This is a public method that delegates to the memory_manager.

Args: content: The information to store as a memory topics: Optional list of topics/categories for the memory (None = auto-classify)

Returns: MemoryStorageResult: Structured result with detailed status information

525            entity_type: Type of the entity
526

async def query_lightrag_knowledge_direct(self, query: str, params: dict) -> str: 
555    async def query_lightrag_knowledge_direct(self, query: str, params: dict) -> str:
556        """Directly query the LightRAG knowledge base and return the raw response.
557

559

562            params: A dictionary of query parameters
563
564        Returns:
565            String with query results exactly as LightRAG returns them
566        """
567        return await self.knowledge_manager.query_graph(query)

def get_agent_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]: 
709    def get_agent_info(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
710        """Get comprehensive information about the agent configuration and tools.
711
712        Returns:
713            Dictionary containing detailed agent configuration and tool information
714        """
715        # Get basic tool info
716        built_in_tools = []
717        mcp_tools = []
718
719        if self.agent and hasattr(self.agent, "tools"):
720            for tool in self.agent.tools:
721                tool_name = getattr(tool, "__name__", str(type(tool).__name__))
722                tool_doc = getattr(tool, "__doc__", "No description available")
723
724                # Clean up docstring for display
725                if tool_doc:
726                    tool_doc = tool_doc.strip().split("\n")[0]  # First line only
727
728                if tool_name.startswith("use_") and "_server" in tool_name:
729                    mcp_tools.append(
730                        {
731                            "name": tool_name,
732                            "description": tool_doc,
733                            "type": "MCP Server",
734                        }
735                    )
736                else:
737                    built_in_tools.append(
738                        {
739                            "name": tool_name,
740                            "description": tool_doc,
741                            "type": "Built-in Tool",
742                        }
743                    )
744
745        # MCP server details
746        mcp_server_details = {}
747        if self.enable_mcp and self.mcp_servers:
748            for server_name, config in self.mcp_servers.items():
749                mcp_server_details[server_name] = {
750                    "command": config.get("command", "N/A"),
751                    "description": config.get(
752                        "description", f"Access to {server_name} MCP server"
753                    ),
754                    "args_count": len(config.get("args", [])),
755                    "env_vars": len(config.get("env", {})),
756                }
757
758        return {
759            "framework": "agno",
760            "model_provider": self.model_provider,
761            "model_name": self.model_name,
762            "memory_enabled": self.enable_memory,
763            "knowledge_enabled": self.agno_knowledge is not None,
764            "lightrag_knowledge_enabled": self.lightrag_knowledge_enabled,
765            "mcp_enabled": self.enable_mcp,
766            "debug_mode": self.debug,
767            "user_id": self.user_id,
768            "initialized": self.agent is not None,
769            "storage_dir": self.storage_dir,
770            "knowledge_dir": self.knowledge_dir,
771            "lightrag_url": LIGHTRAG_URL,
772            "lightrag_memory_url": LIGHTRAG_MEMORY_URL,
773            "tool_counts": {
774                "total": len(built_in_tools) + len(mcp_tools),
775                "built_in": len(built_in_tools),
776                "mcp": len(mcp_tools),
777                "mcp_servers": len(self.mcp_servers) if self.enable_mcp else 0,
778            },
779            "built_in_tools": built_in_tools,
780            "mcp_tools": mcp_tools,
781            "mcp_servers": mcp_server_details,
782        }

Get comprehensive information about the agent configuration and tools.

Returns: Dictionary containing detailed agent configuration and tool information

def print_agent_info(self, console: Optional[rich.console.Console] = None) -> None: 
784    def print_agent_info(self, console: Optional[Console] = None) -> None:
785        """Pretty print comprehensive agent information using Rich.
786
787        Args:
788            console: Optional Rich Console instance. If None, creates a new one.
789        """
790        if console is None:
791            console = Console()
792
793        info = self.get_agent_info()
794
795        # Main agent info table
796        main_table = Table(
797            title=" Personal AI Agent Configuration",
798            show_header=True,
799            header_style="bold magenta",
800        )
801        main_table.add_column("Setting", style="cyan", no_wrap=True)
802        main_table.add_column("Value", style="green")
803
804        main_table.add_row("Framework", info["framework"])
805        main_table.add_row("Model Provider", f"{info['model_provider']}")
806        main_table.add_row("Model Name", info["model_name"])
807        main_table.add_row("Memory Enabled", str(info["memory_enabled"]))
808        main_table.add_row("Knowledge Enabled", str(info["knowledge_enabled"]))
809        main_table.add_row(
810            "LightRAG Knowledge", str(info["lightrag_knowledge_enabled"])
811        )
812        main_table.add_row("MCP Enabled", str(info["mcp_enabled"]))
813        main_table.add_row("Debug Mode", str(info["debug_mode"]))
814        main_table.add_row("User ID", info["user_id"])
815        main_table.add_row("Storage Directory", info["storage_dir"])
816        main_table.add_row("Knowledge Directory", info["knowledge_dir"])
817        main_table.add_row("Total Tools", str(info["tool_counts"]["total"]))
818
819        console.print(main_table)
820
821        # Tools table
822        tools_table = Table(
823            title=" Available Tools",
824            show_header=True,
825            header_style="bold magenta",
826        )
827        tools_table.add_column("Name", style="cyan")
828        tools_table.add_column("Type", style="yellow")
829        tools_table.add_column("Description", style="green")
830
831        # Add built-in tools
832        for tool in info["built_in_tools"]:
833            tools_table.add_row(
834                tool["name"], tool["type"], tool.get("description", "No description")
835            )
836
837        # Add MCP tools
838        for tool in info["mcp_tools"]:
839            tools_table.add_row(
840                tool["name"], tool["type"], tool.get("description", "No description")
841            )
842
843        console.print(tools_table)
844
845        # MCP servers table if enabled
846        if info["mcp_enabled"] and info["mcp_servers"]:
847            mcp_table = Table(
848                title=" MCP Servers",
849                show_header=True,
850                header_style="bold magenta",
851            )
852            mcp_table.add_column("Server Name", style="cyan")
853            mcp_table.add_column("Command", style="yellow")
854            mcp_table.add_column("Description", style="green")
855            mcp_table.add_column("Args Count", style="blue")
856            mcp_table.add_column("Env Vars", style="blue")
857
858            for server_name, server_info in info["mcp_servers"].items():
859                mcp_table.add_row(
860                    server_name,
861                    server_info["command"],
862                    server_info["description"],
863                    str(server_info["args_count"]),
864                    str(server_info["env_vars"]),
865                )
866
867            console.print(mcp_table)

Pretty print comprehensive agent information using Rich.

Args: console: Optional Rich Console instance. If None, creates a new one.

async def cleanup(self) -> None: 
869    async def cleanup(self) -> None:
870        """Clean up resources when the agent is being shut down.
871        
872        This method is called during application shutdown to properly
873        clean up any resources, connections, or background tasks.
874        """
875        try:
876            logger.info("Cleaning up AgnoPersonalAgent resources...")
877            
878            # Clean up agent resources
879            if self.agent:
880                # Clear the agent reference
881                self.agent = None
882                logger.debug("Cleared agent reference")
883            
884            # Clean up storage references
885            if self.agno_storage:
886                self.agno_storage = None
887                logger.debug("Cleared storage reference")
888                
889            if self.agno_knowledge:
890                self.agno_knowledge = None
891                logger.debug("Cleared knowledge reference")
892                
893            if self.agno_memory:
894                self.agno_memory = None
895                logger.debug("Cleared memory reference")
896                
897            if self.knowledge_coordinator:
898                self.knowledge_coordinator = None
899                logger.debug("Cleared knowledge coordinator reference")
900            
901            # Clean up manager references safely
902            if self.model_manager:
903                self.model_manager = None
904                logger.debug("Cleared model manager reference")
905                
906            if self.instruction_manager:
907                self.instruction_manager = None
908                logger.debug("Cleared instruction manager reference")
909                
910            if self.memory_manager:
911                self.memory_manager = None
912                logger.debug("Cleared memory manager reference")
913                
914            if self.knowledge_manager:
915                self.knowledge_manager = None
916                logger.debug("Cleared knowledge manager reference")
917                
918            if self.tool_manager:
919                self.tool_manager = None
920                logger.debug("Cleared tool manager reference")
921            
922            logger.info("AgnoPersonalAgent cleanup completed successfully")
923            
924        except Exception as e:
925            logger.warning("Error during AgnoPersonalAgent cleanup: %s", e)

Clean up resources when the agent is being shut down.

This method is called during application shutdown to properly clean up any resources, connections, or background tasks.

def sync_cleanup(self) -> None: 
927    def sync_cleanup(self) -> None:
928        """Synchronous cleanup method for compatibility.
929        
930        This method provides a synchronous interface to cleanup for cases
931        where async cleanup cannot be used.
932        """
933        try:
934            logger.info("Running synchronous cleanup...")
935            
936            # Clean up agent resources without async calls
937            if self.agent:
938                self.agent = None
939                logger.debug("Cleared agent reference")
940            
941            # Clean up storage references
942            if self.agno_storage:
943                self.agno_storage = None
944                logger.debug("Cleared storage reference")
945                
946            if self.agno_knowledge:
947                self.agno_knowledge = None
948                logger.debug("Cleared knowledge reference")
949                
950            if self.agno_memory:
951                self.agno_memory = None
952                logger.debug("Cleared memory reference")
953                
954            if self.knowledge_coordinator:
955                self.knowledge_coordinator = None
956                logger.debug("Cleared knowledge coordinator reference")
957            
958            # Clean up manager references
959            self.model_manager = None
960            self.instruction_manager = None
961            self.memory_manager = None
962            self.knowledge_manager = None
963            self.tool_manager = None
964            
965            logger.info("Synchronous cleanup completed successfully")
966            
967        except Exception as e:
968            logger.warning("Error during synchronous cleanup: %s", e)

Synchronous cleanup method for compatibility.

This method provides a synchronous interface to cleanup for cases where async cleanup cannot be used.

async def create_agno_agent( model_provider: str = 'ollama', model_name: str = 'qwen3:1.7b', enable_memory: bool = True, enable_mcp: bool = True, storage_dir: str = '/Users/Shared/personal_agent_data/agno/Eric', knowledge_dir: str = '/Users/Shared/personal_agent_data/agno/Eric/knowledge', debug: bool = False, ollama_base_url: str = 'http://tesla.local:11434', user_id: str = 'Eric', recreate: bool = False, instruction_level: personal_agent.core.agent_instruction_manager.InstructionLevel = <InstructionLevel.STANDARD: 3>) -> AgnoPersonalAgent: 
1050async def create_agno_agent(
1051    model_provider: str = "ollama",
1052    model_name: str = LLM_MODEL,
1053    enable_memory: bool = True,
1054    enable_mcp: bool = True,
1055    storage_dir: str = AGNO_STORAGE_DIR,
1056    knowledge_dir: str = AGNO_KNOWLEDGE_DIR,
1057    debug: bool = False,
1058    ollama_base_url: str = OLLAMA_URL,
1059    user_id: str = USER_ID,
1060    recreate: bool = False,
1061    instruction_level: InstructionLevel = InstructionLevel.STANDARD,
1062) -> AgnoPersonalAgent:
1063    """Create and initialize an agno-based personal agent.
1064
1065    Args:
1066        model_provider: LLM provider ('ollama' or 'openai')
1067        model_name: Model name to use
1068        enable_memory: Whether to enable memory and knowledge features
1069        enable_mcp: Whether to enable MCP tool integration
1070        storage_dir: Directory for Agno storage files
1071        knowledge_dir: Directory containing knowledge files to load
1072        debug: Enable debug mode
1073        ollama_base_url: Base URL for Ollama API
1074        user_id: User identifier for memory operations
1075        recreate: Whether to recreate knowledge bases
1076        instruction_level: The sophistication level for agent instructions
1077        
1078    Returns:
1079        Initialized agent instance
1080    """
1081    agent = AgnoPersonalAgent(
1082        model_provider=model_provider,
1083        model_name=model_name,
1084        enable_memory=enable_memory,
1085        enable_mcp=enable_mcp,
1086        storage_dir=storage_dir,
1087        knowledge_dir=knowledge_dir,
1088        debug=debug,
1089        ollama_base_url=ollama_base_url,
1090        user_id=user_id,
1091        recreate=recreate,
1092        instruction_level=instruction_level,
1093    )
1094
1095    success = await agent.initialize(recreate=recreate)
1096    if not success:
1097        raise RuntimeError("Failed to initialize agno agent")
1098
1099    return agent

Create and initialize an agno-based personal agent.

Args: model_provider: LLM provider ('ollama' or 'openai') model_name: Model name to use enable_memory: Whether to enable memory and knowledge features enable_mcp: Whether to enable MCP tool integration storage_dir: Directory for Agno storage files knowledge_dir: Directory containing knowledge files to load debug: Enable debug mode ollama_base_url: Base URL for Ollama API user_id: User identifier for memory operations recreate: Whether to recreate knowledge bases instruction_level: The sophistication level for agent instructions

Returns: Initialized agent instance

def create_simple_personal_agent( storage_dir: str = None, knowledge_dir: str = None, model_provider: str = 'ollama', model_name: str = 'qwen3:1.7b'): 
 971def create_simple_personal_agent(
 972    storage_dir: str = None,
 973    knowledge_dir: str = None,
 974    model_provider: str = "ollama",
 975    model_name: str = LLM_MODEL,
 976):
 977    """Create a simple personal agent following the working pattern from knowledge_agent_example.py
 978
 979    This function creates an agent with knowledge base integration using the simple
 980    pattern that avoids async initialization complexity.
 981
 982    Args:
 983        storage_dir: Directory for storage files (defaults to DATA_DIR/agno)
 984        knowledge_dir: Directory containing knowledge files (defaults to DATA_DIR/knowledge)
 985        model_provider: LLM provider ('ollama' or 'openai')
 986        model_name: Model name to use
 987        
 988    Returns:
 989        Tuple of (Agent instance, knowledge_base) or (Agent, None) if no knowledge
 990    """
 991    from agno.knowledge.combined import CombinedKnowledgeBase
 992    
 993    # Create knowledge base (synchronous creation)
 994    knowledge_base = create_combined_knowledge_base(storage_dir, knowledge_dir)
 995
 996    # Create the model
 997    if model_provider == "openai":
 998        model = OpenAIChat(id=model_name)
 999    elif model_provider == "ollama":
1000        model = Ollama(id=model_name)
1001    else:
1002        raise ValueError(f"Unsupported model provider: {model_provider}")
1003
1004    # Create agent with simple pattern
1005    agent = Agent(
1006        name="Personal AI Agent",
1007        model=model,
1008        knowledge=knowledge_base,
1009        search_knowledge=True,  # Enable automatic knowledge search
1010        show_tool_calls=True,  # Show what tools the agent uses
1011        markdown=True,  # Format responses in markdown
1012        instructions=[
1013            "You are a personal AI assistant with access to the user's knowledge base.",
1014            "Always search your knowledge base when asked about personal information.",
1015            "Provide detailed responses based on the information you find.",
1016            "If you can't find specific information, say so clearly.",
1017            "Include relevant details from the knowledge base in your responses.",
1018        ],
1019    )
1020
1021    logger.info(" Created simple personal agent")
1022    if knowledge_base:
1023        logger.info("   Knowledge base: Enabled")
1024        logger.info("   Search enabled: %s", agent.search_knowledge)
1025    else:
1026        logger.info("   Knowledge base: None (no knowledge files found)")
1027
1028    return agent, knowledge_base

Create a simple personal agent following the working pattern from knowledge_agent_example.py

This function creates an agent with knowledge base integration using the simple pattern that avoids async initialization complexity.

Args: storage_dir: Directory for storage files (defaults to DATA_DIR/agno) knowledge_dir: Directory containing knowledge files (defaults to DATA_DIR/knowledge) model_provider: LLM provider ('ollama' or 'openai') model_name: Model name to use

Returns: Tuple of (Agent instance, knowledge_base) or (Agent, None) if no knowledge

async def load_agent_knowledge(knowledge_base, recreate: bool = False) -> None: 
1031async def load_agent_knowledge(knowledge_base, recreate: bool = False) -> None:
1032    """Load knowledge base content asynchronously.
1033
1034    This should be called after creating the agent to load the knowledge content.
1035
1036    Args:
1037        knowledge_base: Knowledge base instance to load
1038        recreate: Whether to recreate the knowledge base from scratch
1039        
1040    Returns:
1041        None
1042    """
1043    if knowledge_base:
1044        await load_combined_knowledge_base(knowledge_base, recreate=recreate)
1045        logger.info(" Knowledge base loaded successfully")
1046    else:
1047        logger.info("No knowledge base to load")

Load knowledge base content asynchronously.

This should be called after creating the agent to load the knowledge content.

Args: knowledge_base: Knowledge base instance to load recreate: Whether to recreate the knowledge base from scratch

Returns: None

@dataclass
class SemanticMemoryManager: 
 299@dataclass
 300class SemanticMemoryManager:
 301    """
 302    Semantic Memory Manager that provides LLM-free memory management.
 303
 304    This manager combines the structure of Agno's MemoryManager with semantic search
 305    and duplicate detection capabilities, without requiring LLM invocation.
 306    """
 307
 308    # Required by Agno Memory class - model attribute
 309    model: Optional[Model] = Field(default=None)
 310
 311    # Configuration
 312    config: SemanticMemoryManagerConfig = Field(
 313        default_factory=SemanticMemoryManagerConfig
 314    )
 315
 316    # Components
 317    topic_classifier: TopicClassifier = Field(default_factory=TopicClassifier)
 318    duplicate_detector: SemanticDuplicateDetector = Field(default=None)
 319
 320    # State tracking
 321    memories_updated: bool = Field(default=False)
 322
 323    def __init__(
 324        self,
 325        model: Optional[Model] = None,
 326        config: Optional[SemanticMemoryManagerConfig] = None,
 327        similarity_threshold: float = 0.8,
 328        enable_semantic_dedup: bool = True,
 329        enable_exact_dedup: bool = True,
 330        enable_topic_classification: bool = True,
 331        debug_mode: bool = False,
 332    ):
 333        """Initialize the Semantic Memory Manager."""
 334        if config is None:
 335            config = SemanticMemoryManagerConfig(
 336                similarity_threshold=similarity_threshold,
 337                enable_semantic_dedup=enable_semantic_dedup,
 338                enable_exact_dedup=enable_exact_dedup,
 339                enable_topic_classification=enable_topic_classification,
 340                debug_mode=debug_mode,
 341            )
 342
 343        self.model = model  # Required by Agno Memory class
 344        self.config = config
 345
 346        # Get the correct path to topics.yaml
 347        current_dir = os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__))
 348        topics_yaml_path = os.path.join(current_dir, "topics.yaml")
 349
 350        self.topic_classifier = TopicClassifier(config_path=topics_yaml_path)
 351        self.duplicate_detector = SemanticDuplicateDetector(
 352            similarity_threshold=config.similarity_threshold
 353        )
 354        self.memories_updated = False
 355
 356        if self.config.debug_mode:
 357            logger.setLevel(logging.DEBUG)
 358
 359        logger.info(
 360            "Initialized SemanticMemoryManager with similarity_threshold=%.2f",
 361            config.similarity_threshold,
 362        )
 363
 364    def _is_exact_duplicate(
 365        self, new_memory: str, existing_memories: List[UserMemory]
 366    ) -> Optional[UserMemory]:
 367        """Check for exact duplicate memories."""
 368        if not self.config.enable_exact_dedup:
 369            return None
 370
 371        new_memory_clean = new_memory.strip().lower()
 372
 373        for existing in existing_memories:
 374            existing_clean = existing.memory.strip().lower()
 375            if new_memory_clean == existing_clean:
 376                logger.debug("Exact duplicate found: '%s'", new_memory)
 377                return existing
 378
 379        return None
 380
 381    def _is_semantic_duplicate(
 382        self, new_memory: str, existing_memories: List[UserMemory]
 383    ) -> Optional[UserMemory]:
 384        """Check for semantic duplicate memories."""
 385        if not self.config.enable_semantic_dedup:
 386            return None
 387
 388        existing_texts = [mem.memory for mem in existing_memories]
 389        is_dup, best_match, similarity = self.duplicate_detector.is_duplicate(
 390            new_memory, existing_texts
 391        )
 392
 393        if is_dup and best_match:
 394            # Find the matching memory object
 395            for existing in existing_memories:
 396                if existing.memory == best_match:
 397                    logger.debug(
 398                        "Semantic duplicate found (similarity: %.2f): '%s' ~ '%s'",
 399                        similarity,
 400                        new_memory,
 401                        existing.memory,
 402                    )
 403                    return existing
 404
 405        return None
 406
 407    def _should_reject_memory(
 408        self, new_memory: str, existing_memories: List[UserMemory]
 409    ) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 410        """Determine if a memory should be rejected."""
 411        # Check memory length
 412        if len(new_memory) > self.config.max_memory_length:
 413            return (
 414                True,
 415                f"Memory too long ({len(new_memory)} > {self.config.max_memory_length} chars)",
 416            )
 417
 418        # Check for exact duplicates
 419        exact_duplicate = self._is_exact_duplicate(new_memory, existing_memories)
 420        if exact_duplicate:
 421            return True, f"Exact duplicate of: '{exact_duplicate.memory}'"
 422
 423        # Check for semantic duplicates
 424        semantic_duplicate = self._is_semantic_duplicate(new_memory, existing_memories)
 425        if semantic_duplicate:
 426            return True, f"Semantic duplicate of: '{semantic_duplicate.memory}'"
 427
 428        return False, ""
 429
 430    def _get_recent_memories(self, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str) -> List[UserMemory]:
 431        """Get recent memories for duplicate checking."""
 432        try:
 433            memory_rows = db.read_memories(
 434                user_id=user_id, limit=self.config.recent_memory_limit, sort="desc"
 435            )
 436
 437            user_memories = []
 438            for row in memory_rows:
 439                if row.user_id == user_id and row.memory:
 440                    try:
 441                        user_memory = UserMemory.from_dict(row.memory)
 442                        user_memories.append(user_memory)
 443                    except (ValueError, KeyError, TypeError) as e:
 444                        logger.warning(
 445                            "Failed to convert memory row to UserMemory: %s", e
 446                        )
 447
 448            return user_memories
 449        except Exception as e:
 450            logger.error("Error retrieving recent memories: %s", e)
 451            return []
 452
 453    def add_memory(
 454        self,
 455        memory_text: str,
 456        db: MemoryDb,
 457        user_id: str = None,
 458        topics: Optional[List[str]] = None,
 459        input_text: Optional[str] = None,
 460    ) -> MemoryStorageResult:
 461        """
 462        Add a memory with duplicate detection and topic classification.
 463
 464        :param memory_text: The memory text to add
 465        :param db: Memory database instance
 466        :param user_id: User ID for the memory
 467        :param topics: Optional list of topics (will be auto-classified if not provided)
 468        :param input_text: Optional input text that generated this memory
 469        :return: MemoryStorageResult with detailed status information
 470        """
 471        # Get current user ID if not provided
 472        if user_id is None:
 473            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 474            
 475        # Validate input
 476        if not memory_text or not memory_text.strip():
 477            return MemoryStorageResult(
 478                status=MemoryStorageStatus.CONTENT_EMPTY,
 479                message="Memory content cannot be empty",
 480                local_success=False,
 481                graph_success=False
 482            )
 483
 484        # Get recent memories for duplicate checking
 485        existing_memories = self._get_recent_memories(db, user_id)
 486
 487        # Check memory length
 488        if len(memory_text) > self.config.max_memory_length:
 489            return MemoryStorageResult(
 490                status=MemoryStorageStatus.CONTENT_TOO_LONG,
 491                message=f"Memory too long ({len(memory_text)} > {self.config.max_memory_length} chars)",
 492                local_success=False,
 493                graph_success=False
 494            )
 495
 496        # Check for exact duplicates
 497        exact_duplicate = self._is_exact_duplicate(memory_text, existing_memories)
 498        if exact_duplicate:
 499            return MemoryStorageResult(
 500                status=MemoryStorageStatus.DUPLICATE_EXACT,
 501                message=f"Exact duplicate of: '{exact_duplicate.memory}'",
 502                local_success=False,
 503                graph_success=False,
 504                similarity_score=1.0
 505            )
 506
 507        # Check for semantic duplicates
 508        semantic_duplicate = self._is_semantic_duplicate(memory_text, existing_memories)
 509        if semantic_duplicate:
 510            # Get similarity score for the duplicate
 511            existing_texts = [mem.memory for mem in existing_memories]
 512            _, _, similarity_score = self.duplicate_detector.is_duplicate(memory_text, existing_texts)
 513            
 514            return MemoryStorageResult(
 515                status=MemoryStorageStatus.DUPLICATE_SEMANTIC,
 516                message=f"Semantic duplicate of: '{semantic_duplicate.memory}'",
 517                local_success=False,
 518                graph_success=False,
 519                similarity_score=similarity_score
 520            )
 521
 522        # Auto-classify topics if not provided
 523        if topics is None and self.config.enable_topic_classification:
 524            topics = self.topic_classifier.classify(memory_text)
 525
 526        # Create the memory
 527        try:
 528            from uuid import uuid4
 529
 530            memory_id = str(uuid4())
 531            last_updated = datetime.now()
 532
 533            user_memory = UserMemory(
 534                memory_id=memory_id,
 535                memory=memory_text,
 536                topics=topics,
 537                last_updated=last_updated,
 538                input=input_text,
 539            )
 540
 541            memory_row = MemoryRow(
 542                id=memory_id,
 543                user_id=user_id,
 544                memory=user_memory.to_dict(),
 545                last_updated=last_updated,
 546            )
 547
 548            db.upsert_memory(memory_row)
 549
 550            self.memories_updated = True
 551
 552            logger.info(
 553                "Added memory for user %s: '%s' (topics: %s)",
 554                user_id,
 555                memory_text,
 556                topics,
 557            )
 558            if self.config.debug_mode:
 559                print(f" ACCEPTED: '{memory_text}' (topics: {topics})")
 560
 561            return MemoryStorageResult(
 562                status=MemoryStorageStatus.SUCCESS,
 563                message="Memory added successfully",
 564                memory_id=memory_id,
 565                topics=topics,
 566                local_success=True,
 567                graph_success=False  # Will be updated by the caller for dual storage
 568            )
 569
 570        except Exception as e:
 571            error_msg = f"Error adding memory: {e}"
 572            logger.error(error_msg)
 573            return MemoryStorageResult(
 574                status=MemoryStorageStatus.STORAGE_ERROR,
 575                message=error_msg,
 576                local_success=False,
 577                graph_success=False
 578            )
 579
 580    def update_memory(
 581        self,
 582        memory_id: str,
 583        memory_text: str,
 584        db: MemoryDb,
 585        user_id: str = None,
 586        topics: Optional[List[str]] = None,
 587        input_text: Optional[str] = None,
 588    ) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 589        """
 590        Update an existing memory.
 591
 592        :param memory_id: ID of the memory to update
 593        :param memory_text: New memory text
 594        :param db: Memory database instance
 595        :param user_id: User ID for the memory
 596        :param topics: Optional list of topics (will be auto-classified if not provided)
 597        :param input_text: Optional input text that generated this memory
 598        :return: Tuple of (success, message)
 599        """
 600        # Get current user ID if not provided
 601        if user_id is None:
 602            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 603            
 604        # Auto-classify topics if not provided
 605        if topics is None and self.config.enable_topic_classification:
 606            topics = self.topic_classifier.classify(memory_text)
 607
 608        try:
 609            last_updated = datetime.now()
 610
 611            user_memory = UserMemory(
 612                memory_id=memory_id,
 613                memory=memory_text,
 614                topics=topics,
 615                last_updated=last_updated,
 616                input=input_text,
 617            )
 618
 619            memory_row = MemoryRow(
 620                id=memory_id,
 621                user_id=user_id,
 622                memory=user_memory.to_dict(),
 623                last_updated=last_updated,
 624            )
 625
 626            db.upsert_memory(memory_row)
 627
 628            self.memories_updated = True
 629
 630            logger.info(
 631                "Updated memory %s for user %s: '%s'", memory_id, user_id, memory_text
 632            )
 633            if self.config.debug_mode:
 634                print(f" UPDATED: '{memory_text}' (topics: {topics})")
 635
 636            return True, "Memory updated successfully"
 637
 638        except Exception as e:
 639            error_msg = f"Error updating memory: {e}"
 640            logger.error(error_msg)
 641            return False, error_msg
 642
 643    def delete_memory(
 644        self, memory_id: str, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None
 645    ) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 646        """
 647        Delete a memory.
 648
 649        :param memory_id: ID of the memory to delete
 650        :param db: Memory database instance
 651        :param user_id: User ID for the memory
 652        :return: Tuple of (success, message)
 653        """
 654        try:
 655            db.delete_memory(memory_id)
 656
 657            self.memories_updated = True
 658
 659            logger.info("Deleted memory %s for user %s", memory_id, user_id)
 660            if self.config.debug_mode:
 661                print(f" DELETED: {memory_id}")
 662
 663            return True, "Memory deleted successfully"
 664
 665        except Exception as e:
 666            error_msg = f"Error deleting memory: {e}"
 667            logger.error(error_msg)
 668            return False, error_msg
 669
 670    def delete_memories_by_topic(
 671        self, topics: List[str], db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None
 672    ) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 673        """
 674        Delete all memories associated with a specific topic or list of topics.
 675
 676        :param topics: A list of topics to delete memories for.
 677        :param db: Memory database instance.
 678        :param user_id: User ID for the memories.
 679        :return: Tuple of (success, message).
 680        """
 681        # Get current user ID if not provided
 682        if user_id is None:
 683            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 684            
 685        if not topics:
 686            return False, "No topics provided for deletion."
 687
 688        try:
 689            # Get all memories for the specified topics
 690            memories_to_delete = self.get_memories_by_topic(
 691                db=db, user_id=user_id, topics=topics
 692            )
 693
 694            if not memories_to_delete:
 695                return (
 696                    True,
 697                    f"No memories found for topics: {', '.join(topics)}.",
 698                )
 699
 700            deleted_count = 0
 701            for memory in memories_to_delete:
 702                success, _ = self.delete_memory(
 703                    memory_id=memory.memory_id, db=db, user_id=user_id
 704                )
 705                if success:
 706                    deleted_count += 1
 707
 708            self.memories_updated = True
 709
 710            logger.info(
 711                "Deleted %d memories for topics '%s' for user %s",
 712                deleted_count,
 713                ", ".join(topics),
 714                user_id,
 715            )
 716            if self.config.debug_mode:
 717                print(
 718                    f" DELETED BY TOPIC: {deleted_count} memories for topics: {', '.join(topics)}"
 719                )
 720
 721            return (
 722                True,
 723                f"Successfully deleted {deleted_count} memories for topics: {', '.join(topics)}.",
 724            )
 725
 726        except Exception as e:
 727            error_msg = f"Error deleting memories by topic: {e}"
 728            logger.error(error_msg)
 729            return False, error_msg
 730
 731    def clear_memories(self, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None) -> Tuple[bool, str]:
 732        """
 733        Clear all memories for a user.
 734
 735        :param db: Memory database instance
 736        :param user_id: User ID for the memories
 737        :return: Tuple of (success, message)
 738        """
 739        # Get current user ID if not provided
 740        if user_id is None:
 741            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 742            
 743        try:
 744            # Get all memories for the user first
 745            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id)
 746
 747            # Delete each memory
 748            for row in memory_rows:
 749                if row.user_id == user_id:
 750                    db.delete_memory(row.id)
 751
 752            self.memories_updated = True
 753
 754            logger.info("Cleared all memories for user %s", user_id)
 755            if self.config.debug_mode:
 756                print(f" CLEARED: All memories for user {user_id}")
 757
 758            return True, f"Cleared {len(memory_rows)} memories successfully"
 759
 760        except Exception as e:
 761            error_msg = f"Error clearing memories: {e}"
 762            logger.error(error_msg)
 763            return False, error_msg
 764
 765    def search_memories(
 766        self,
 767        query: str,
 768        db: MemoryDb,
 769        user_id: str = None,
 770        limit: int = None,
 771        similarity_threshold: float = 0.3,
 772        search_topics: bool = True,
 773        topic_boost: float = 0.5,
 774    ) -> List[Tuple[UserMemory, float]]:
 775        """
 776        Search memories using semantic similarity and topic matching with enhanced query expansion.
 777
 778        :param query: Search query
 779        :param db: Memory database instance
 780        :param user_id: User ID to search within
 781        :param limit: Maximum number of results
 782        :param similarity_threshold: Minimum similarity threshold for content
 783        :param search_topics: Whether to include topic search (default: True)
 784        :param topic_boost: Score boost for topic matches (default: 0.5)
 785        :return: List of (UserMemory, combined_score) tuples
 786        """
 787        # Get current user ID if not provided
 788        if user_id is None:
 789            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 790            
 791        try:
 792            # Enhanced query expansion for better semantic matching
 793            expanded_queries = self._expand_query(query)
 794
 795            # Get all memories for the user
 796            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id)
 797
 798            user_memories = []
 799            for row in memory_rows:
 800                if row.user_id == user_id and row.memory:
 801                    try:
 802                        user_memory = UserMemory.from_dict(row.memory)
 803                        user_memories.append(user_memory)
 804                    except (ValueError, KeyError, TypeError) as e:
 805                        logger.warning(
 806                            "Failed to convert memory row to UserMemory: %s", e
 807                        )
 808
 809            # Calculate similarities and topic matches
 810            results = []
 811            query_lower = query.lower().strip()
 812
 813            for memory in user_memories:
 814                max_similarity = 0.0
 815                best_query = query
 816
 817                # Test original query and all expanded queries
 818                for test_query in expanded_queries:
 819                    content_similarity = (
 820                        self.duplicate_detector._calculate_semantic_similarity(
 821                            test_query, memory.memory
 822                        )
 823                    )
 824                    if content_similarity > max_similarity:
 825                        max_similarity = content_similarity
 826                        best_query = test_query
 827
 828                # Topic matching with enhanced search
 829                topic_score = 0.0
 830                topic_matches = []
 831
 832                if search_topics and memory.topics:
 833                    for topic in memory.topics:
 834                        # Check original query and expanded queries against topics
 835                        for test_query in expanded_queries:
 836                            test_query_lower = test_query.lower()
 837                            if (
 838                                test_query_lower in topic.lower()
 839                                or topic.lower() in test_query_lower
 840                            ):
 841                                if test_query_lower == topic.lower():
 842                                    topic_score = 1.0  # Exact topic match
 843                                    topic_matches.append(topic)
 844                                    break
 845                                else:
 846                                    topic_score = max(
 847                                        topic_score, 0.8
 848                                    )  # Partial topic match
 849                                    topic_matches.append(topic)
 850
 851                # Enhanced keyword matching for work-related queries
 852                keyword_score = self._calculate_keyword_score(
 853                    expanded_queries, memory.memory
 854                )
 855
 856                # Combined scoring: use the best of content similarity, topic match, or keyword match
 857                final_score = max(
 858                    max_similarity, topic_score * topic_boost, keyword_score
 859                )
 860
 861                if (
 862                    final_score >= similarity_threshold
 863                    or topic_score > 0
 864                    or keyword_score > 0.4
 865                ):
 866                    results.append((memory, final_score))
 867
 868                    if self.config.debug_mode and (
 869                        topic_matches or keyword_score > 0.4
 870                    ):
 871                        logger.debug(
 872                            "Enhanced match for query '%s': memory='%s', topics=%s, final_score=%.3f (content=%.3f, topic=%.3f, keyword=%.3f)",
 873                            query,
 874                            memory.memory[:50],
 875                            topic_matches,
 876                            final_score,
 877                            max_similarity,
 878                            topic_score,
 879                            keyword_score,
 880                        )
 881
 882            # Sort by combined score (descending) and limit
 883            results.sort(key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
 884            return results[:limit]
 885
 886        except Exception as e:
 887            logger.error("Error searching memories: %s", e)
 888            return []
 889
 890    def get_memories_by_topic(
 891        self,
 892        db: MemoryDb,
 893        user_id: str = None,
 894        topics: Optional[List[str]] = None,
 895        limit: Optional[int] = None,
 896    ) -> List[UserMemory]:
 897        """
 898        Get memories filtered by a list of topics, with enhanced topic expansion using the topic classifier.
 899
 900        :param db: Memory database instance
 901        :param user_id: User ID to search within
 902        :param topics: Optional list of topics to filter by. If None, returns all memories.
 903        :param limit: Maximum number of results to return
 904        :return: List of UserMemory objects matching the topics.
 905        """
 906        # Get current user ID if not provided
 907        if user_id is None:
 908            user_id = get_current_user_id()
 909            
 910        try:
 911            # Get all memories for the user
 912            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id, sort="desc")
 913
 914            user_memories = []
 915            for row in memory_rows:
 916                if row.user_id == user_id and row.memory:
 917                    try:
 918                        user_memory = UserMemory.from_dict(row.memory)
 919                        user_memories.append(user_memory)
 920                    except (ValueError, KeyError, TypeError) as e:
 921                        logger.warning(
 922                            "Failed to convert memory row to UserMemory: %s", e
 923                        )
 924
 925            if not topics:
 926                # If no topics are specified, return all memories up to the limit
 927                return user_memories[:limit]
 928
 929            # ENHANCED: Expand topics using the topic classifier
 930            # This solves the issue where searching for "education" doesn't find "academic" memories
 931            expanded_topics = set()
 932            
 933            for topic in topics:
 934                topic_lower = topic.lower()
 935                expanded_topics.add(topic_lower)  # Add the original topic
 936                
 937                # Check if this topic appears as a keyword in any category
 938                for category, keywords in self.topic_classifier.categories.items():
 939                    if topic_lower in [kw.lower() for kw in keywords]:
 940                        # Add the category name
 941                        expanded_topics.add(category.lower())
 942                        logger.debug(f"Expanded topic '{topic}' to include category '{category}'")
 943                        break
 944                
 945                # Also check if this topic is a category name, and if so, add all its keywords
 946                if topic_lower in [cat.lower() for cat in self.topic_classifier.categories.keys()]:
 947                    # Find the actual category name (with correct case)
 948                    for category, keywords in self.topic_classifier.categories.items():
 949                        if category.lower() == topic_lower:
 950                            for keyword in keywords:
 951                                expanded_topics.add(keyword.lower())
 952                            logger.debug(f"Expanded category '{topic}' to include keywords: {keywords}")
 953                            break
 954
 955            # Filter memories by the expanded topics
 956            filtered_memories = []
 957            for memory in user_memories:
 958                if memory.topics and any(
 959                    t.lower() in expanded_topics for t in memory.topics
 960                ):
 961                    filtered_memories.append(memory)
 962
 963            # Sort by date (already sorted by read_memories) and limit
 964            return filtered_memories[:limit]
 965
 966        except Exception as e:
 967            logger.error("Error getting memories by topic: %s", e)
 968            return []
 969
 970    def _expand_query(self, query: str) -> List[str]:
 971        """
 972        Expand query with synonyms, related terms, and topic classifier mappings for better semantic matching.
 973
 974        :param query: Original search query
 975        :return: List of expanded queries including the original
 976        """
 977        query_lower = query.lower().strip()
 978        expanded = [query]  # Always include original query
 979
 980        # NEW: Use topic classifier to find which categories the query keywords belong to
 981        # This solves the issue where searching for "education" doesn't find "academic" memories
 982        query_words = query_lower.split()
 983        for word in query_words:
 984            # Check if this word appears in any category's keywords
 985            for category, keywords in self.topic_classifier.categories.items():
 986                if word in [kw.lower() for kw in keywords]:
 987                    # Add the category name as an expanded query
 988                    if category not in expanded:
 989                        expanded.append(category)
 990                    
 991                    # Also add other keywords from the same category
 992                    for related_keyword in keywords:
 993                        related_lower = related_keyword.lower()
 994                        if related_lower != word and related_lower not in expanded:
 995                            expanded.append(related_lower)
 996                    
 997                    # Stop after finding the first matching category for this word
 998                    # (though a word could theoretically be in multiple categories)
 999                    break
1000            
1001            # Also check phrases for more comprehensive matching
1002            for category, phrases in self.topic_classifier.phrases.items():
1003                for phrase in phrases:
1004                    if word in phrase.lower().split():
1005                        # Add the category name
1006                        if category not in expanded:
1007                            expanded.append(category)
1008                        # Add the full phrase
1009                        if phrase.lower() not in expanded:
1010                            expanded.append(phrase.lower())
1011
1012        # Work-related expansions (keeping existing hardcoded synonyms for backward compatibility)
1013        work_synonyms = {
1014            "work": [
1015                "job",
1016                "employment",
1017                "career",
1018                "occupation",
1019                "position",
1020                "company",
1021                "employer",
1022                "workplace",
1023            ],
1024            "workplace": ["work", "job", "office", "company", "employer", "business"],
1025            "job": ["work", "employment", "career", "position", "occupation", "role"],
1026            "company": ["employer", "business", "organization", "workplace", "firm"],
1027            "career": ["job", "work", "profession", "occupation", "employment"],
1028        }
1029
1030        # Education-related expansions
1031        education_synonyms = {
1032            "school": ["university", "college", "education", "academic", "institution"],
1033            "university": ["college", "school", "education", "academic", "institution"],
1034            "degree": ["education", "qualification", "diploma", "certification"],
1035            "study": ["education", "learning", "academic", "school", "university"],
1036        }
1037
1038        # Personal-related expansions
1039        personal_synonyms = {
1040            "hobby": ["interest", "activity", "pastime", "recreation", "leisure"],
1041            "interest": ["hobby", "passion", "activity", "like", "enjoy"],
1042            "like": ["enjoy", "prefer", "love", "interest", "hobby"],
1043            "preference": ["like", "prefer", "choice", "favorite"],
1044        }
1045
1046        # Combine all synonym dictionaries
1047        all_synonyms = {**work_synonyms, **education_synonyms, **personal_synonyms}
1048
1049        # Add synonyms for words in the query
1050        for word in query_words:
1051            if word in all_synonyms:
1052                for synonym in all_synonyms[word]:
1053                    # Create expanded queries by replacing the word with synonyms
1054                    expanded_query = query_lower.replace(word, synonym)
1055                    if expanded_query not in expanded:
1056                        expanded.append(expanded_query)
1057
1058                    # Also add just the synonym
1059                    if synonym not in expanded:
1060                        expanded.append(synonym)
1061
1062        return expanded
1063
1064    def _calculate_keyword_score(self, queries: List[str], memory_text: str) -> float:
1065        """
1066        Calculate keyword-based similarity score for enhanced matching.
1067
1068        :param queries: List of query variations to test
1069        :param memory_text: Memory text to search in
1070        :return: Keyword similarity score (0.0 to 1.0)
1071        """
1072        memory_lower = memory_text.lower()
1073        max_score = 0.0
1074
1075        for query in queries:
1076            query_words = query.lower().split()
1077            if not query_words:
1078                continue
1079
1080            matches = 0
1081            for word in query_words:
1082                if (
1083                    len(word) > 2 and word in memory_lower
1084                ):  # Only count words longer than 2 chars
1085                    matches += 1
1086
1087            if query_words:
1088                score = matches / len(query_words)
1089                max_score = max(max_score, score)
1090
1091        return max_score
1092
1093    def get_all_memories(self, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None) -> List[UserMemory]:
1094        """
1095        Get all memories for a user.
1096
1097        :param db: Memory database instance
1098        :param user_id: User ID to retrieve memories for
1099        :return: List of UserMemory objects
1100        """
1101        # Get current user ID if not provided
1102        if user_id is None:
1103            user_id = get_current_user_id()
1104            
1105        try:
1106            # Get all memories for the user
1107            memory_rows = db.read_memories(user_id=user_id, sort="desc")
1108
1109            user_memories = []
1110            for row in memory_rows:
1111                if row.user_id == user_id and row.memory:
1112                    try:
1113                        user_memory = UserMemory.from_dict(row.memory)
1114                        user_memories.append(user_memory)
1115                    except (ValueError, KeyError, TypeError) as e:
1116                        logger.warning(
1117                            "Failed to convert memory row to UserMemory: %s", e
1118                        )
1119
1120            logger.info("Retrieved %d memories for user %s", len(user_memories), user_id)
1121            return user_memories
1122
1123        except Exception as e:
1124            logger.error("Error retrieving all memories: %s", e)
1125            return []
1126
1127    def get_memory_stats(self, db: MemoryDb, user_id: str = None) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1128        """
1129        Get statistics about memories for a user.
1130
1131        :param db: Memory database instance
1132        :param user_id: User ID to analyze
1133        :return: Dictionary with memory statistics
1134        """
1135        # Get current user ID if not provided
1136        if user_id is None:
1137            user_id = get_current_user_id()
1138            
1139        try:
1140            memories = self._get_recent_memories(db, user_id)
1141
1142            if not memories:
1143                return {"total_memories": 0}
1144
1145            # Topic distribution
1146            topic_counts = {}
1147            for memory in memories:
1148                if memory.topics:
1149                    for topic in memory.topics:
1150                        topic_counts[topic] = topic_counts.get(topic, 0) + 1
1151
1152            # Average memory length
1153            avg_length = sum(len(m.memory) for m in memories) / len(memories)
1154
1155            # Recent activity (memories in last 24 hours)
1156            recent_count = 0
1157            if memories:
1158                cutoff = datetime.now().replace(
1159                    hour=0, minute=0, second=0, microsecond=0
1160                )
1161                for memory in memories:
1162                    if memory.last_updated and memory.last_updated >= cutoff:
1163                        recent_count += 1
1164
1165            return {
1166                "total_memories": len(memories),
1167                "topic_distribution": topic_counts,
1168                "average_memory_length": avg_length,
1169                "recent_memories_24h": recent_count,
1170                "most_common_topic": (
1171                    max(topic_counts.items(), key=lambda x: x[1])[0]
1172                    if topic_counts
1173                    else None
1174                ),
1175            }
1176
1177        except Exception as e:
1178            logger.error("Error getting memory stats: %s", e)
1179            return {"error": str(e)}
1180
1181    def process_input(
1182        self,
1183        input_text: str,
1184        db: MemoryDb,
1185        user_id: str = None,
1186        extract_multiple: bool = True,
1187    ) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1188        """
1189        Process input text and extract memories without using LLM.
1190
1191        This method uses simple heuristics to determine if the input contains
1192        memorable information and extracts it accordingly.
1193
1194        :param input_text: Input text to process
1195        :param db: Memory database instance
1196        :param user_id: User ID for the memories
1197        :param extract_multiple: Whether to try extracting multiple memories from input
1198        :return: Dictionary with processing results
1199        """
1200        results = {
1201            "memories_added": [],
1202            "memories_rejected": [],
1203            "total_processed": 0,
1204            "success": True,
1205            "message": "Processing completed",
1206        }
1207
1208        try:
1209            # Simple heuristics to extract memorable statements
1210            memorable_statements = self._extract_memorable_statements(input_text)
1211
1212            for statement in memorable_statements:
1213                result = self.add_memory(
1214                    memory_text=statement,
1215                    db=db,
1216                    user_id=user_id,
1217                    input_text=input_text,
1218                )
1219
1220                results["total_processed"] += 1
1221
1222                if result.is_success:
1223                    results["memories_added"].append(
1224                        {
1225                            "memory_id": result.memory_id,
1226                            "memory": statement,
1227                            "topics": result.topics,
1228                        }
1229                    )
1230                else:
1231                    results["memories_rejected"].append(
1232                        {"memory": statement, "reason": result.message}
1233                    )
1234
1235            if results["memories_added"]:
1236                self.memories_updated = True
1237
1238        except Exception as e:
1239            results["success"] = False
1240            results["message"] = f"Error processing input: {e}"
1241            logger.error("Error processing input: %s", e)
1242
1243        return results
1244
1245    def create_or_update_memories(
1246        self,
1247        messages: List,  # List[Message] from agno.models.message
1248        existing_memories: List[Dict[str, Any]],
1249        user_id: str,
1250        db: MemoryDb,
1251        delete_memories: bool = True,
1252        clear_memories: bool = True,
1253    ) -> str:
1254        """
1255        Create or update memories based on messages - LLM-free implementation.
1256
1257        This method provides the same interface as Agno's MemoryManager but uses
1258        semantic analysis instead of LLM calls for better performance and reliability.
1259
1260        :param messages: List of Message objects to process
1261        :param existing_memories: List of existing memory dictionaries
1262        :param user_id: User ID for the memories
1263        :param db: Memory database instance
1264        :param delete_memories: Whether deletion is enabled (not used in our implementation)
1265        :param clear_memories: Whether clearing is enabled (not used in our implementation)
1266        :return: String describing the actions taken
1267        """
1268        logger.debug("SemanticMemoryManager.create_or_update_memories Start")
1269
1270        # Create a simple memory class for duplicate checking
1271        class SimpleMemory:
1272            def __init__(self, memory_text: str, memory_id: str = ""):
1273                self.memory = memory_text
1274                self.memory_id = memory_id
1275
1276        # Convert existing memories to UserMemory objects for our processing
1277        existing_user_memories = []
1278        for mem_dict in existing_memories:
1279            try:
1280                # Create a UserMemory-like object for our duplicate detection
1281                memory_text = mem_dict.get("memory", "")
1282                if memory_text:
1283                    existing_user_memories.append(
1284                        SimpleMemory(memory_text, mem_dict.get("memory_id", ""))
1285                    )
1286            except Exception as e:
1287                logger.warning(f"Failed to process existing memory: {e}")
1288
1289        # Extract text content from messages
1290        message_texts = []
1291        for message in messages:
1292            if hasattr(message, "content") and message.content:
1293                if hasattr(message, "role") and message.role == "user":
1294                    # Only process user messages for memory extraction
1295                    message_texts.append(str(message.content))
1296            elif hasattr(message, "get_content_string"):
1297                # Use agno's method to get content
1298                content = message.get_content_string()
1299                if content and hasattr(message, "role") and message.role == "user":
1300                    message_texts.append(content)
1301
1302        if not message_texts:
1303            logger.debug("No user messages found to process")
1304            return "No user messages to process for memory creation"
1305
1306        # Combine all message texts
1307        combined_input = " ".join(message_texts)
1308
1309        # Extract memorable statements
1310        memorable_statements = self._extract_memorable_statements(combined_input)
1311
1312        if not memorable_statements:
1313            logger.debug("No memorable statements found in messages")
1314            return "No memorable information found in the messages"
1315
1316        # Process each memorable statement
1317        actions_taken = []
1318        memories_added = 0
1319        memories_rejected = 0
1320
1321        for statement in memorable_statements:
1322            # Check for duplicates against existing memories
1323            should_reject, reason = self._should_reject_memory(
1324                statement, existing_user_memories
