 122            """A tool that wraps the public store_user_memory method."""
 123            result = await self.store_user_memory(content=content, topics=topics)
 124
 125            # Format the result for user display
 126            if result.is_success:
 127                if result.status == MemoryStorageStatus.SUCCESS:
 128                    return f" {result.message}"
 129                elif result.status == MemoryStorageStatus.SUCCESS_LOCAL_ONLY:
 130                    return f" {result.message}"
 131            else:
 132                # Handle different rejection types with appropriate emojis
 133                if result.status == MemoryStorageStatus.DUPLICATE_EXACT:
 134                    return f" {result.message}"
 135                elif result.status == MemoryStorageStatus.DUPLICATE_SEMANTIC:
 136                    return f" {result.message} (similarity: {result.similarity_score:.2f})"
 137                elif result.status == MemoryStorageStatus.CONTENT_EMPTY:
 138                    return f" {result.message}"
 139                elif result.status == MemoryStorageStatus.CONTENT_TOO_LONG:
 140                    return f" {result.message}"
 141                else:
 142                    return f" {result.message}"
 143
 144        async def query_memory_tool(query: str, limit: Union[int, None] = None) -> str:
 145            """Search user memories using direct SemanticMemoryManager calls."""
 146            return await self.query_memory(query, limit)
 147
 148        async def update_memory_tool(
 149            memory_id: str, content: str, topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None
 150        ) -> str:
 151            """Update an existing memory."""
 152            return await self.update_memory(memory_id, content, topics)
 153
 154        async def delete_memory_tool(memory_id: str) -> str:
 155            """Delete a memory from both SQLite and LightRAG systems."""
 156            return await self.delete_memory(memory_id)
 157
 158        async def get_recent_memories_tool(limit: int = 10) -> str:
 159            """Get recent memories by searching all memories and sorting by date."""
 160            return await self.get_recent_memories(limit)
 161
 162        async def get_all_memories_tool() -> str:
 163            """Get all user memories."""
 164            return await self.get_all_memories()
 165
 166        async def get_memory_stats_tool() -> str:
 167            """Get memory statistics."""
 168            return await self.get_memory_stats()
 169
 170        async def get_memories_by_topic_tool(
 171            topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None, limit: Union[int, None] = None
 172        ) -> str:
 173            """Get memories by topic without similarity search."""
 174            return await self.get_memories_by_topic(topics, limit)
 175
 176        async def list_memories_tool() -> str:
 177            """List all memories in a simple, user-friendly format."""
 178            return await self.list_memories()
 179
 180        async def store_graph_memory_tool(
 181            content: str,
 182            topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None,
 183            memory_id: str = None,
 184        ) -> str:
 185            """Store a memory in the LightRAG graph database to capture relationships."""
 186            return await self.store_graph_memory(content, topics, memory_id)
 187
 188        async def query_graph_memory_tool(
 189            query: str,
 190            mode: str = "mix",
 191            top_k: int = 5,
 192            response_type: str = "Multiple Paragraphs",
 193        ) -> dict:
 194            """Query the LightRAG memory graph to explore relationships between memories."""
 195            return await self.query_graph_memory(query, mode, top_k, response_type)
 196
 197        async def get_memory_graph_labels_tool() -> str:
 198            """Get the list of all entity and relation labels from the memory graph."""
 199            return await self.get_memory_graph_labels()
 200
 201        async def clear_memories_tool() -> str:
 202            """Clear all memories for the user using direct SemanticMemoryManager calls."""
 203            try:
 204                # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.clear_memories()
 205                success, message = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.clear_memories(
 206                    db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
 207                )
 208
 209                if success:
 210                    logger.info("Cleared all memories for user %s", self.user_id)
 211                    return f" {message}"
 212                else:
 213                    logger.error("Failed to clear memories: %s", message)
 214                    return f" Error clearing memories: {message}"
 215
 216            except Exception as e:
 217                logger.error("Error clearing memories: %s", e)
 218                return f" Error clearing memories: {str(e)}"
 219
 220        async def delete_memories_by_topic_tool(topics: Union[List[str], str]) -> str:
 221            """Delete all memories associated with a specific topic or list of topics."""
 222            try:
 223                if isinstance(topics, str):
 224                    topics = [t.strip() for t in topics.split(",")]
 225
 226                (
 227                    success,
 228                    message,
 229                ) = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.delete_memories_by_topic(
 230                    topics=topics, db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
 231                )
 232
 233                if success:
 234                    logger.info(
 235                        "Deleted memories for topics '%s' for user %s",
 236                        ", ".join(topics),
 237                        self.user_id,
 238                    )
 239                    return f" {message}"
 240                else:
 241                    logger.error(
 242                        "Failed to delete memories for topics %s: %s",
 243                        ", ".join(topics),
 244                        message,
 245                    )
 246                    return f" Error deleting memories by topic: {message}"
 247
 248            except Exception as e:
 249                logger.error("Error deleting memories by topic: %s", e)
 250                return f" Error deleting memories by topic: {str(e)}"
 251
 252        async def clear_all_memories_tool() -> str:
 253            """Clear all memories from both SQLite and LightRAG systems."""
 254            return await self.clear_all_memories()
 255
 256        # Set proper function names for tool identification
 257        store_user_memory_tool.__name__ = "store_user_memory"
 258        query_memory_tool.__name__ = "query_memory"
 259        update_memory_tool.__name__ = "update_memory"
 260        delete_memory_tool.__name__ = "delete_memory"
 261        delete_memories_by_topic_tool.__name__ = "delete_memories_by_topic"
 262        clear_memories_tool.__name__ = "clear_memories"
 263        clear_all_memories_tool.__name__ = "clear_all_memories"
 264        get_recent_memories_tool.__name__ = "get_recent_memories"
 265        get_all_memories_tool.__name__ = "get_all_memories"
 266        get_memory_stats_tool.__name__ = "get_memory_stats"
 267        get_memories_by_topic_tool.__name__ = "get_memories_by_topic"
 268        list_memories_tool.__name__ = "list_memories"
 269        store_graph_memory_tool.__name__ = "store_graph_memory"
 270        query_graph_memory_tool.__name__ = "query_graph_memory"
 271        get_memory_graph_labels_tool.__name__ = "get_memory_graph_labels"
 272
 273        # Add tools to the list
 274        tools.extend(
 275            [
 276                store_user_memory_tool,
 277                query_memory_tool,
 278                update_memory_tool,
 279                delete_memory_tool,
 280                delete_memories_by_topic_tool,
 281                clear_memories_tool,
 282                clear_all_memories_tool,
 283                get_recent_memories_tool,
 284                get_all_memories_tool,
 285                get_memory_stats_tool,
 286                get_memories_by_topic_tool,
 287                list_memories_tool,
 288                store_graph_memory_tool,
 289                query_graph_memory_tool,
 290                get_memory_graph_labels_tool,
 291            ]
 292        )
 293
 294        logger.info(
 295            "Created %d memory tools using direct SemanticMemoryManager calls",
 296            len(tools),
 297        )
 298        return tools
 299
 300    async def store_user_memory(
 301        self, content: str = "", topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None
 302    ) -> MemoryStorageResult:
 303        """Store information as a user memory in BOTH local SQLite and LightRAG graph systems.
 304
 305        Args:
 306            content: The information to store as a memory
 307            topics: Optional list of topics/categories for the memory (None = auto-classify)
 308
 309        Returns:
 310            MemoryStorageResult: Structured result with detailed status information
 311        """
 312        # Validate that content is provided
 313        if not content or not content.strip():
 314            return MemoryStorageResult(
 315                status=MemoryStorageStatus.CONTENT_EMPTY,
 316                message="Content is required to store a memory. Please provide the information you want me to remember.",
 317                local_success=False,
 318                graph_success=False,
 319            )
 320
 321        try:
 322            # Restate the user fact from first-person to third-person
 323            restated_content = self.restate_user_fact(content)
 324            
 325            # SIMPLIFIED TOPIC HANDLING: Handle the common cases simply
 326            if topics is None:
 327                # Leave as None - let memory manager auto-classify
 328                pass
 329            elif isinstance(topics, str):
 330                # Convert string to list, handle comma-separated values
 331                if "," in topics:
 332                    topics = [t.strip() for t in topics.split(",") if t.strip()]
 333                else:
 334                    topics = [topics.strip()] if topics.strip() else None
 335            elif isinstance(topics, list):
 336                # Clean up list - remove empty entries
 337                topics = [str(t).strip() for t in topics if str(t).strip()]
 338                if not topics:
 339                    topics = None
 340            else:
 341                # Convert anything else to string and put in list
 342                topic_str = str(topics).strip()
 343                topics = [topic_str] if topic_str and topic_str != "None" else None
 344
 345            # 1. Store in local SQLite memory system
 346            local_result = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.add_memory(
 347                memory_text=restated_content,
 348                db=self.agno_memory.db,
 349                user_id=self.user_id,
 350                topics=topics,
 351            )
 352
 353            # Handle different rejection cases
 354            if not local_result.is_success:
 355                logger.info("Local memory rejected: %s", local_result.message)
 356                # Return the rejection status directly from the memory manager
 357                return local_result
 358
 359            # Local storage succeeded
 360            logger.info(
 361                "Stored in local memory: %s... (ID: %s)",
 362                content[:50],
 363                local_result.memory_id,
 364            )
 365
 366            # 2. Store in LightRAG graph memory system
 367            graph_success = False
 368            graph_message = ""
 369
 370            try:
 371                # Store in graph memory
 372                graph_result = await self.store_graph_memory(
 373                    restated_content, local_result.topics, local_result.memory_id
 374                )
 375                logger.info("Graph memory result: %s", graph_result)
 376                if "" in graph_result:
 377                    graph_success = True
 378                    graph_message = "Graph memory synced successfully"
 379                else:
 380                    graph_message = f"Graph memory sync failed: {graph_result}"
 381
 382            except Exception as e:
 383                logger.error("Error storing in graph memory: %s", e)
 384                graph_message = f"Graph memory error: {str(e)}"
 385
 386            # Determine final status based on local and graph results
 387            if graph_success:
 388                final_status = MemoryStorageStatus.SUCCESS
 389                final_message = (
 390                    f"Memory stored successfully in both systems: {content[:50]}..."
 391                )
 392                logger.info(
 393                    " DUAL STORAGE SUCCESS: Memory stored in both local SQLite and LightRAG graph"
 394                )
 395            else:
 396                final_status = MemoryStorageStatus.SUCCESS_LOCAL_ONLY
 397                final_message = f"Memory stored in local system only: {content[:50]}... | {graph_message}"
 398                logger.warning(
 399                    " PARTIAL STORAGE: Memory stored in local SQLite only (graph sync failed)"
 400                )
 401
 402            # Return the enhanced result with dual storage information
 403            return MemoryStorageResult(
 404                status=final_status,
 405                message=final_message,
 406                memory_id=local_result.memory_id,
 407                topics=local_result.topics,
 408                local_success=True,
 409                graph_success=graph_success,
 410                similarity_score=local_result.similarity_score,
 411            )
 412
 413        except Exception as e:
 414            logger.error("Error storing user memory: %s", e)
 415            return MemoryStorageResult(
 416                status=MemoryStorageStatus.STORAGE_ERROR,
 417                message=f"Error storing memory: {str(e)}",
 418                local_success=False,
 419                graph_success=False,
 420            )
 421
 422    def restate_user_fact(self, content: str) -> str:
 423        """Restate a user fact from first-person to third-person.
 424
 425        This method converts statements like "I have a PhD" to "{user_id} has a PhD"
 426        to ensure correct entity mapping in the knowledge graph.
 427
 428        Args:
 429            content: The original fact from the user
 430
 431        Returns:
 432            The restated fact
 433        """
 434        # Ensure user_id is a safe string for replacement
 435        user_id_str = str(self.user_id)
 436
 437        # Define regex patterns for pronoun and verb replacement
 438        # Using word boundaries (\b) to avoid replacing parts of words like "mine" in "mining"
 439        patterns = [
 440            (r"\bI am\b", f"{user_id_str} is"),
 441            (r"\bI was\b", f"{user_id_str} was"),
 442            (r"\bI have\b", f"{user_id_str} has"),
 443            (r"\bI'm\b", f"{user_id_str} is"),
 444            (r"\bI've\b", f"{user_id_str} has"),
 445            (r"\bI\b", user_id_str),
 446            (r"\bmy\b", f"{user_id_str}'s"),
 447            (r"\bmine\b", f"{user_id_str}'s"),
 448            (r"\bmyself\b", user_id_str),
 449        ]
 450
 451        restated_content = content
 452        for pattern, replacement in patterns:
 453            # Use re.IGNORECASE to handle variations like "i" vs "I"
 454            restated_content = re.sub(
 455                pattern, replacement, restated_content, flags=re.IGNORECASE
 456            )
 457
 458        return restated_content
 459
 460    async def seed_entity_in_graph(self, entity_name: str, entity_type: str) -> bool:
 461        """Seed an entity into the graph by creating and uploading a physical file.
 462
 463        Args:
 464            entity_name: Name of the entity to create
 465            entity_type: Type of the entity
 466
 467        Returns:
 468            True if entity was successfully seeded
 469        """
 470        try:
 471            # Create a minimal document to seed the entity
 472            seed_text = f"{entity_name} is a {entity_type.lower()}."
 473
 474            # Create a unique filename for this entity seed
 475            entity_hash = hashlib.md5(
 476                f"{entity_name}_{entity_type}_{time.time()}".encode()
 477            ).hexdigest()[:8]
 478            filename = f"entity_seed_{entity_name.replace(' ', '_').replace('/', '_')}_{entity_hash}.txt"
 479
 480            # Create a temporary file
 481            with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(
 482                mode="w", suffix=".txt", delete=False
 483            ) as temp_file:
 484                temp_file.write(seed_text)
 485                temp_file_path = temp_file.name
 486
 487            try:
 488                # Upload the file using the /documents/upload endpoint
 489                url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents/upload"
 490
 491                async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
 492                    with open(temp_file_path, "rb") as file:
 493                        # Create form data for file upload
 494                        data = aiohttp.FormData()
 495                        data.add_field(
 496                            "file", file, filename=filename, content_type="text/plain"
 497                        )
 498
 499                        async with session.post(url, data=data, timeout=30) as resp:
 500                            if resp.status in [200, 201]:
 501                                logger.info(
 502                                    f"Successfully seeded entity: {entity_name}"
 503                                )
 504                                return True
 505                            else:
 506                                error_detail = await resp.text()
 507                                logger.warning(
 508                                    f"Failed to seed entity {entity_name}: {error_detail}"
 509                                )
 510                                return False
 511
 512            finally:
 513                # Clean up the temporary file
 514                try:
 515                    os.unlink(temp_file_path)
 516                except OSError:
 517                    pass  # Ignore cleanup errors
 518
 519        except Exception as e:
 520            logger.error(f"Error seeding entity {entity_name}: {e}")
 521            return False
 522
 523    async def check_entity_exists(self, entity_name: str) -> bool:
 524        """Check if entity exists in the graph using the correct /graph/entity/exists endpoint.
 525
 526        Args:
 527            entity_name: Name of the entity to check
 528
 529        Returns:
 530            True if entity exists
 531        """
 532        try:
 533            url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/entity/exists"
 534
 535            # Try different parameter formats that LightRAG might expect
 536            params_options = [
 537                {"entity_name": entity_name},
 538                {"name": entity_name},
 539                {"entity": entity_name},
 540            ]
 541
 542            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
 543                for params in params_options:
 544                    try:
 545                        async with session.get(url, params=params, timeout=10) as resp:
 546                            if resp.status == 200:
 547                                result = await resp.json()
 548                                # Handle different response formats
 549                                if isinstance(result, bool):
 550                                    exists = result
 551                                elif isinstance(result, dict):
 552                                    exists = result.get("exists", False) or result.get(
 553                                        "found", False
 554                                    )
 555                                else:
 556                                    exists = False
 557
 558                                logger.debug(
 559                                    f"Entity {entity_name} exists: {exists} (params: {params})"
 560                                )
 561                                return exists
 562                            elif resp.status == 422:
 563                                # Try next parameter format
 564                                continue
 565                            else:
 566                                logger.warning(
 567                                    f"Failed to check entity existence for {entity_name}: {resp.status}"
 568                                )
 569                                break
 570                    except Exception as e:
 571                        logger.debug(f"Error with params {params}: {e}")
 572                        continue
 573
 574                # If all parameter formats fail, fall back to label list approach
 575                logger.debug(
 576                    f"All parameter formats failed for {entity_name}, falling back to label list"
 577                )
 578                url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/label/list"
 579                async with session.get(url, timeout=10) as resp:
 580                    if resp.status == 200:
 581                        labels_data = await resp.json()
 582
 583                        # Handle both response formats: direct array or dict with 'labels' key
 584                        if isinstance(labels_data, list):
 585                            all_labels = labels_data
 586                        elif isinstance(labels_data, dict) and "labels" in labels_data:
 587                            all_labels = labels_data["labels"]
 588                        else:
 589                            all_labels = []
 590
 591                        # Check if entity name exists in labels (case-insensitive)
 592                        exists = any(
 593                            label.lower() == entity_name.lower() for label in all_labels
 594                        )
 595                        logger.debug(
 596                            f"Entity {entity_name} exists (via labels): {exists}"
 597                        )
 598                        return exists
 599                    else:
 600                        logger.warning(
 601                            f"Failed to get graph labels for entity check: {resp.status}"
 602                        )
 603                        return False
 604
 605        except Exception as e:
 606            logger.error(f"Error checking entity existence for {entity_name}: {e}")
 607            return False
 608
 609    async def clear_all_memories(self) -> str:
 610        """Clear all memories from both SQLite and LightRAG systems using the centralized service.
 611
 612        This method provides a complete reset of the dual memory system by:
 613        1. Clearing all memories from the local SQLite database
 614        2. Clearing all documents from the LightRAG memory server
 615        3. Clearing the memory_inputs directory (NEW)
 616        4. Deleting the knowledge graph file
 617        5. Clearing server cache
 618
 619        Returns:
 620            str: Success or error message
 621        """
 622        try:
 623            # Import the centralized clearing service
 624            from ..core.memory_clearing_service import MemoryClearingService, ClearingOptions
 625            
 626            # Create the clearing service
 627            clearing_service = MemoryClearingService(
 628                user_id=self.user_id,
 629                agno_memory=self.agno_memory,
 630                lightrag_memory_url=self.lightrag_memory_url,
 631                verbose=False  # Keep quiet for agent use
 632            )
 633            
 634            # Create clearing options
 635            options = ClearingOptions(
 636                dry_run=False,
 637                semantic_only=False,
 638                lightrag_only=False,
 639                include_memory_inputs=True,  # NEW: Include memory inputs clearing
 640                include_knowledge_graph=True,
 641                include_cache=True,
 642                verbose=False
 643            )
 644            
 645            # Use the centralized service to clear all memories
 646            service_results = await clearing_service.clear_all_memories(options)
 647            
 648            # Convert service results to user-friendly messages
 649            results = []
 650            
 651            # Process semantic memory results
 652            if service_results["semantic_memory"]["attempted"]:
 653                semantic_result = service_results["semantic_memory"]["result"]
 654                if semantic_result and semantic_result.success:
 655                    results.append(f" Local memory: {semantic_result.message}")
 656                    logger.info("Cleared all memories from SQLite for user %s", self.user_id)
 657                else:
 658                    error_msg = semantic_result.message if semantic_result else "Unknown error"
 659                    results.append(f" Local memory error: {error_msg}")
 660                    logger.error("Failed to clear memories from SQLite: %s", error_msg)
 661            
 662            # Process LightRAG memory results
 663            if service_results["lightrag_memory"]["attempted"]:
 664                lightrag_result = service_results["lightrag_memory"]["result"]
 665                if lightrag_result and lightrag_result.success:
 666                    results.append(f" Graph memory: {lightrag_result.message}")
 667                    logger.info("Cleared all memories from LightRAG")
 668                else:
 669                    error_msg = lightrag_result.message if lightrag_result else "Unknown error"
 670                    results.append(f" Graph memory error: {error_msg}")
 671                    logger.error("Failed to clear memories from LightRAG: %s", error_msg)
 672            
 673            # Process memory inputs results (NEW)
 674            if service_results["memory_inputs"]["attempted"]:
 675                inputs_result = service_results["memory_inputs"]["result"]
 676                if inputs_result and inputs_result.success:
 677                    results.append(f" Memory inputs: {inputs_result.message}")
 678                    logger.info("Cleared memory inputs directory")
 679                else:
 680                    error_msg = inputs_result.message if inputs_result else "Unknown error"
 681                    results.append(f" Memory inputs error: {error_msg}")
 682                    logger.error("Failed to clear memory inputs: %s", error_msg)
 683            
 684            # Process knowledge graph results
 685            if service_results["knowledge_graph"]["attempted"]:
 686                graph_result = service_results["knowledge_graph"]["result"]
 687                if graph_result and graph_result.success:
 688                    results.append(f" Knowledge graph: {graph_result.message}")
 689                    logger.info("Deleted knowledge graph files")
 690                else:
 691                    error_msg = graph_result.message if graph_result else "Unknown error"
 692                    results.append(f" Knowledge graph error: {error_msg}")
 693                    logger.error("Failed to delete knowledge graph files: %s", error_msg)
 694            
 695            # Process server cache results
 696            if service_results["server_cache"]["attempted"]:
 697                cache_result = service_results["server_cache"]["result"]
 698                if cache_result and cache_result.success:
 699                    results.append(f" Server cache: {cache_result.message}")
 700                    logger.info("Cleared server cache")
 701                else:
 702                    error_msg = cache_result.message if cache_result else "Unknown error"
 703                    results.append(f" Server cache error: {error_msg}")
 704                    logger.error("Failed to clear server cache: %s", error_msg)
 705            
 706            # Return combined results
 707            return " | ".join(results)
 708
 709        except Exception as e:
 710            logger.error("Error clearing all memories: %s", e)
 711            return f" Error clearing all memories: {str(e)}"
 712
 713    # The following methods will be implemented in subsequent phases
 714    # They are placeholders for now
 715
 716    async def query_memory(self, query: str, limit: Union[int, None] = None) -> str:
 717        """Search user memories using direct SemanticMemoryManager calls.
 718
 719        Args:
 720            query: The query to search for in memories
 721            limit: Maximum number of memories to return
 722
 723        Returns:
 724            str: Found memories or message if none found
 725        """
 726        try:
 727            stripped_query = query.strip().lower()
 728
 729            # List of phrases that should trigger get_all_memories instead of search
 730            get_all_phrases = [
 731                "all",
 732                "all memories",
 733                "everything",
 734                "summarize all memories",
 735                "what do you know about me",
 736                "what have i told you",
 737                "list all memories",
 738                "show all memories",
 739                "tell me everything",
 740                "list everything you know",
 741            ]
 742
 743            if stripped_query in get_all_phrases:
 744                logger.info(
 745                    "Generic query '%s' detected. Delegating to get_all_memories.",
 746                    query,
 747                )
 748                return await self.get_all_memories()
 749
 750            # Validate query parameter
 751            if not query or not query.strip():
 752                logger.warning("Empty query provided to query_memory")
 753                return " Error: Query cannot be empty. Please provide a search term."
 754
 755            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.search_memories()
 756            results = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.search_memories(
 757                query=query.strip(),
 758                db=self.agno_memory.db,
 759                user_id=self.user_id,
 760                limit=limit,
 761                similarity_threshold=0.3,
 762                search_topics=True,
 763                topic_boost=0.5,
 764            )
 765
 766            if not results:
 767                logger.info("No matching memories found for query: %s", query)
 768                return f" No memories found for '{query}'. Try different keywords or ask me to remember something new!"
 769
 770            # Format results
 771            display_memories = results[:limit] if limit else results
 772            result_note = f" MEMORY RETRIEVAL (found {len(results)} matches via semantic search)"
 773
 774            result = f"{result_note}: The following memories were found for '{query}'. You must restate this information addressing the user as 'you' (second person), not as if you are the user:\n\n"
 775
 776            for i, (memory, score) in enumerate(display_memories, 1):
 777                result += f"{i}. {memory.memory} (similarity: {score:.2f})\n"
 778                if memory.topics:
 779                    result += f"   Topics: {', '.join(memory.topics)}\n"
 780                result += "\n"
 781
 782            result += "\nREMEMBER: Restate this information as an AI assistant talking ABOUT the user, not AS the user. Use 'you' instead of 'I' when referring to the user's information."
 783
 784            logger.info("Found %d matching memories for query: %s", len(results), query)
 785            return result
 786
 787        except Exception as e:
 788            logger.error("Error querying memories: %s", e)
 789            return f" Error searching memories: {str(e)}"
 790
 791    async def update_memory(
 792        self, memory_id: str, content: str, topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None
 793    ) -> str:
 794        """Update an existing memory using direct SemanticMemoryManager calls.
 795
 796        Args:
 797            memory_id: ID of the memory to update
 798            content: New memory content
 799            topics: Optional list of topics/categories for the memory
 800
 801        Returns:
 802            str: Success or error message
 803        """
 804        try:
 805            # SIMPLIFIED TOPIC HANDLING: Handle the common cases simply
 806            if topics is None:
 807                # Leave as None - let memory manager auto-classify
 808                pass
 809            elif isinstance(topics, str):
 810                # Convert string to list, handle comma-separated values
 811                if "," in topics:
 812                    topics = [t.strip() for t in topics.split(",") if t.strip()]
 813                else:
 814                    topics = [topics.strip()] if topics.strip() else None
 815            elif isinstance(topics, list):
 816                # Clean up list - remove empty entries
 817                topics = [str(t).strip() for t in topics if str(t).strip()]
 818                if not topics:
 819                    topics = None
 820            else:
 821                # Convert anything else to string and put in list
 822                topic_str = str(topics).strip()
 823                topics = [topic_str] if topic_str and topic_str != "None" else None
 824
 825            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.update_memory()
 826            success, message = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.update_memory(
 827                memory_id=memory_id,
 828                memory_text=content,
 829                db=self.agno_memory.db,
 830                user_id=self.user_id,
 831                topics=topics,
 832            )
 833
 834            if success:
 835                logger.info("Updated memory %s: %s...", memory_id, content[:50])
 836                return f" Successfully updated memory: {content[:50]}..."
 837            else:
 838                logger.error("Failed to update memory %s: %s", memory_id, message)
 839                return f" Error updating memory: {message}"
 840
 841        except Exception as e:
 842            logger.error("Error updating memory: %s", e)
 843            return f" Error updating memory: {str(e)}"
 844
 845    async def delete_memory(self, memory_id: str) -> str:
 846        """Delete a memory from both SQLite and LightRAG systems.
 847
 848        Args:
 849            memory_id: ID of the memory to delete
 850
 851        Returns:
 852            str: Success or error message
 853        """
 854        try:
 855            results = []
 856
 857            # 1. Delete from local SQLite memory system
 858            success, message = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.delete_memory(
 859                memory_id=memory_id, db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
 860            )
 861
 862            if success:
 863                logger.info("Deleted memory %s from SQLite", memory_id)
 864                results.append(" Local memory: Deleted successfully")
 865            else:
 866                logger.error(
 867                    "Failed to delete memory %s from SQLite: %s", memory_id, message
 868                )
 869                results.append(f" Local memory error: {message}")
 870
 871            # 2. Delete from LightRAG graph memory system
 872            try:
 873                # Construct the filename pattern to search for
 874                filename_pattern = f"memory_{memory_id}_*.txt"
 875
 876                # Use LightRAG API to find documents matching the pattern
 877                url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents"
 878                async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
 879                    async with session.get(url, timeout=30) as resp:
 880                        if resp.status == 200:
 881                            data = await resp.json()
 882                            all_docs = []
 883
 884                            # Extract documents from response
 885                            if isinstance(data, dict) and "statuses" in data:
 886                                statuses = data["statuses"]
 887                                for status_name, docs_list in statuses.items():
 888                                    if isinstance(docs_list, list):
 889                                        all_docs.extend(docs_list)
 890                            elif isinstance(data, dict) and "documents" in data:
 891                                all_docs = data["documents"]
 892                            elif isinstance(data, list):
 893                                all_docs = data
 894
 895                            # Find documents matching our memory_id pattern
 896                            docs_to_delete = []
 897                            for doc in all_docs:
 898                                file_path = doc.get("file_path", "")
 899                                if file_path and f"memory_{memory_id}_" in file_path:
 900                                    docs_to_delete.append(doc)
 901
 902                            if docs_to_delete:
 903                                # Delete the matching documents
 904                                doc_ids = [doc["id"] for doc in docs_to_delete]
 905                                payload = {"doc_ids": doc_ids, "delete_file": True}
 906
 907                                async with session.delete(
 908                                    f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents/delete_document",
 909                                    json=payload,
 910                                    timeout=60,
 911                                ) as del_resp:
 912                                    if del_resp.status == 200:
 913                                        logger.info(
 914                                            "Deleted memory %s from LightRAG", memory_id
 915                                        )
 916                                        results.append(
 917                                            " Graph memory: Deleted successfully"
 918                                        )
 919                                    else:
 920                                        error_text = await del_resp.text()
 921                                        logger.error(
 922                                            "Failed to delete memory %s from LightRAG: %s",
 923                                            memory_id,
 924                                            error_text,
 925                                        )
 926                                        results.append(
 927                                            f" Graph memory error: {error_text}"
 928                                        )
 929                            else:
 930                                logger.info(
 931                                    "No matching documents found in LightRAG for memory %s",
 932                                    memory_id,
 933                                )
 934                                results.append(
 935                                    " Graph memory: No matching documents found"
 936                                )
 937                        else:
 938                            error_text = await resp.text()
 939                            logger.error(
 940                                "Failed to get documents from LightRAG: %s", error_text
 941                            )
 942                            results.append(f" Graph memory error: {error_text}")
 943            except Exception as e:
 944                logger.error("Error deleting from LightRAG: %s", e)
 945                results.append(f" Graph memory error: {str(e)}")
 946
 947            # Return combined results
 948            return " | ".join(results)
 949
 950        except Exception as e:
 951            logger.error("Error deleting memory: %s", e)
 952            return f" Error deleting memory: {str(e)}"
 953
 954    async def get_recent_memories(self, limit: int = 10) -> str:
 955        """Get recent memories by searching all memories and sorting by date.
 956
 957        Args:
 958            limit: Maximum number of memories to return
 959
 960        Returns:
 961            str: Formatted string of recent memories
 962        """
 963        try:
 964            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.get_all_memories()
 965            memories = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.get_all_memories(
 966                db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
 967            )
 968
 969            if not memories:
 970                logger.info("No memories found for user %s", self.user_id)
 971                return " No memories found. Try storing some information first!"
 972
 973            # Sort memories by timestamp (newest first)
 974            sorted_memories = sorted(
 975                memories,
 976                key=lambda m: m.timestamp if hasattr(m, "timestamp") else 0,
 977                reverse=True,
 978            )
 979
 980            # Limit the number of memories
 981            display_memories = sorted_memories[:limit] if limit else sorted_memories
 982
 983            # Format results
 984            result = f" RECENT MEMORIES (showing {len(display_memories)} of {len(memories)} total memories):\n\n"
 985
 986            for i, memory in enumerate(display_memories, 1):
 987                # Format the memory content
 988                result += f"{i}. {memory.memory}\n"
 989
 990                # Add topics if available
 991                if hasattr(memory, "topics") and memory.topics:
 992                    result += f"   Topics: {', '.join(memory.topics)}\n"
 993
 994                # Add timestamp if available
 995                if hasattr(memory, "timestamp") and memory.timestamp:
 996                    # Convert timestamp to readable format
 997                    from datetime import datetime
 998
 999                    timestamp = datetime.fromtimestamp(memory.timestamp)
1000                    result += f"   Created: {timestamp.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n"
1001
1002                # Add memory ID for reference
1003                result += f"   ID: {memory.memory_id}\n\n"
1004
1005            logger.info(
1006                "Retrieved %d recent memories for user %s",
1007                len(display_memories),
1008                self.user_id,
1009            )
1010            return result
1011
1012        except Exception as e:
1013            logger.error("Error retrieving recent memories: %s", e)
1014            return f" Error retrieving recent memories: {str(e)}"
1015
1016    async def get_all_memories(self) -> str:
1017        """Get all user memories.
1018
1019        Returns:
1020            str: Formatted string of all memories
1021        """
1022        try:
1023            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.get_all_memories()
1024            memories = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.get_all_memories(
1025                db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
1026            )
1027
1028            if not memories:
1029                logger.info("No memories found for user %s", self.user_id)
1030                return " No memories found. Try storing some information first!"
1031
1032            # Sort memories by timestamp (newest first)
1033            sorted_memories = sorted(
1034                memories,
1035                key=lambda m: m.timestamp if hasattr(m, "timestamp") else 0,
1036                reverse=True,
1037            )
1038
1039            # Format results
1040            result = f" ALL MEMORIES ({len(memories)} total):\n\n"
1041
1042            for i, memory in enumerate(sorted_memories, 1):
1043                # Format the memory content
1044                result += f"{i}. {memory.memory}\n"
1045
1046                # Add topics if available
1047                if hasattr(memory, "topics") and memory.topics:
1048                    result += f"   Topics: {', '.join(memory.topics)}\n"
1049
1050                # Add timestamp if available
1051                if hasattr(memory, "timestamp") and memory.timestamp:
1052                    # Convert timestamp to readable format
1053                    from datetime import datetime
1054
1055                    timestamp = datetime.fromtimestamp(memory.timestamp)
1056                    result += f"   Created: {timestamp.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n"
1057
1058                # Add memory ID for reference
1059                result += f"   ID: {memory.memory_id}\n\n"
1060
1061            logger.info(
1062                "Retrieved all %d memories for user %s", len(memories), self.user_id
1063            )
1064            return result
1065
1066        except Exception as e:
1067            logger.error("Error retrieving all memories: %s", e)
1068            return f" Error retrieving all memories: {str(e)}"
1069
1070    async def get_memory_stats(self) -> str:
1071        """Get memory statistics.
1072
1073        Returns:
1074            str: Formatted string with memory statistics
1075        """
1076        try:
1077            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.get_all_memories()
1078            memories = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.get_all_memories(
1079                db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
1080            )
1081
1082            if not memories:
1083                logger.info("No memories found for user %s", self.user_id)
1084                return " No memories found. Try storing some information first!"
1085
1086            # Calculate basic statistics
1087            total_memories = len(memories)
1088
1089            # Get all unique topics
1090            all_topics = {}
1091            for memory in memories:
1092                if hasattr(memory, "topics") and memory.topics:
1093                    for topic in memory.topics:
1094                        all_topics[topic] = all_topics.get(topic, 0) + 1
1095
1096            # Sort topics by frequency (most common first)
1097            sorted_topics = sorted(all_topics.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
1098
1099            # Calculate average memory length
1100            total_length = sum(len(memory.memory) for memory in memories)
1101            avg_length = total_length / total_memories if total_memories > 0 else 0
1102
1103            # Get oldest and newest memory timestamps
1104            timestamps = [
1105                memory.timestamp for memory in memories if hasattr(memory, "timestamp")
1106            ]
1107            oldest_timestamp = min(timestamps) if timestamps else None
1108            newest_timestamp = max(timestamps) if timestamps else None
1109
1110            # Format results
1111            result = f" MEMORY STATISTICS\n\n"
1112            result += f"Total memories: {total_memories}\n"
1113            result += f"Average memory length: {avg_length:.1f} characters\n"
1114
1115            if oldest_timestamp:
1116                from datetime import datetime
1117
1118                oldest_date = datetime.fromtimestamp(oldest_timestamp).strftime(
1119                    "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"
1120                )
1121                result += f"Oldest memory: {oldest_date}\n"
1122
1123            if newest_timestamp:
1124                from datetime import datetime
1125
1126                newest_date = datetime.fromtimestamp(newest_timestamp).strftime(
1127                    "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"
1128                )
1129                result += f"Newest memory: {newest_date}\n"
1130
1131            if sorted_topics:
1132                result += f"\nTop topics:\n"
1133                # Show top 10 topics
1134                for topic, count in sorted_topics[:10]:
1135                    result += f"- {topic}: {count} memories\n"
1136
1137                if len(sorted_topics) > 10:
1138                    result += f"... and {len(sorted_topics) - 10} more topics\n"
1139
1140            logger.info("Generated memory statistics for user %s", self.user_id)
1141            return result
1142
1143        except Exception as e:
1144            logger.error("Error retrieving memory statistics: %s", e)
1145            return f" Error retrieving memory statistics: {str(e)}"
1146
1147    async def get_memories_by_topic(
1148        self, topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None, limit: Union[int, None] = None
1149    ) -> str:
1150        """Get memories by topic without similarity search, using enhanced SemanticMemoryManager.
1151
1152        Args:
1153            topics: Topic or list of topics to filter memories by
1154            limit: Maximum number of memories to return
1155
1156        Returns:
1157            str: Formatted string of memories matching the topics
1158        """
1159        try:
1160            # Validate topics parameter
1161            if topics is None:
1162                logger.warning("No topics provided to get_memories_by_topic")
1163                return (
1164                    " Error: No topics provided. Please specify at least one topic."
1165                )
1166
1167            # Parse topics parameter
1168            if isinstance(topics, str):
1169                # Convert string to list, handle comma-separated values
1170                if "," in topics:
1171                    topic_list = [t.strip() for t in topics.split(",") if t.strip()]
1172                else:
1173                    topic_list = [topics.strip()] if topics.strip() else []
1174            elif isinstance(topics, list):
1175                # Clean up list - remove empty entries
1176                topic_list = [str(t).strip() for t in topics if str(t).strip()]
1177            else:
1178                # Convert anything else to string and put in list
1179                topic_str = str(topics).strip()
1180                topic_list = [topic_str] if topic_str and topic_str != "None" else []
1181
1182            if not topic_list:
1183                logger.warning("No valid topics provided after parsing")
1184                return " Error: No valid topics provided. Please specify at least one topic."
1185
1186            # ENHANCED: Use the SemanticMemoryManager's enhanced get_memories_by_topic method
1187            # This method includes topic classifier integration for query expansion
1188            filtered_memories = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.get_memories_by_topic(
1189                db=self.agno_memory.db,
1190                user_id=self.user_id,
1191                topics=topic_list,
1192                limit=limit,
1193            )
1194
1195            if not filtered_memories:
1196                topics_str = ", ".join(topic_list)
1197                logger.info("No memories found for topics: %s", topics_str)
1198                return f" No memories found for topics: {topics_str}. Try different topics or store new memories with these topics."
1199
1200            # Format results
1201            topics_str = ", ".join(topic_list)
1202            result = f" MEMORIES BY TOPIC: {topics_str} (showing {len(filtered_memories)} of {len(filtered_memories)} matching memories)\n\n"
1203
1204            for i, memory in enumerate(filtered_memories, 1):
1205                # Format the memory content
1206                result += f"{i}. {memory.memory}\n"
1207
1208                # Add topics if available
1209                if hasattr(memory, "topics") and memory.topics:
1210                    result += f"   Topics: {', '.join(memory.topics)}\n"
1211
1212                # Add timestamp if available
1213                if hasattr(memory, "timestamp") and memory.timestamp:
1214                    # Convert timestamp to readable format
1215                    from datetime import datetime
1216
1217                    timestamp = datetime.fromtimestamp(memory.timestamp)
1218                    result += f"   Created: {timestamp.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n"
1219
1220                # Add memory ID for reference
1221                result += f"   ID: {memory.memory_id}\n\n"
1222
1223            logger.info(
1224                "Retrieved %d memories for topics %s using enhanced SemanticMemoryManager", 
1225                len(filtered_memories), topics_str
1226            )
1227            return result
1228
1229        except Exception as e:
1230            logger.error("Error retrieving memories by topic: %s", e)
1231            return f" Error retrieving memories by topic: {str(e)}"
1232
1233    async def list_memories(self) -> str:
1234        """List all memories in a simple, user-friendly format.
1235
1236        This method provides a more concise view of all memories compared to get_all_memories,
1237        focusing on just the content and topics without additional metadata.
1238
1239        Returns:
1240            str: Simplified list of all memories
1241        """
1242        try:
1243            # Direct call to SemanticMemoryManager.get_all_memories()
1244            memories = self.agno_memory.memory_manager.get_all_memories(
1245                db=self.agno_memory.db, user_id=self.user_id
1246            )
1247
1248            if not memories:
1249                logger.info("No memories found for user %s", self.user_id)
1250                return " No memories found. Try storing some information first!"
1251
1252            # Sort memories by timestamp (newest first)
1253            sorted_memories = sorted(
1254                memories,
1255                key=lambda m: m.timestamp if hasattr(m, "timestamp") else 0,
1256                reverse=True,
1257            )
1258
1259            # Format results in a simplified way
1260            result = f" MEMORY LIST ({len(memories)} total):\n\n"
1261
1262            for i, memory in enumerate(sorted_memories, 1):
1263                # Just show the memory content and topics, omit other metadata
1264                memory_preview = (
1265                    memory.memory[:100] + "..."
1266                    if len(memory.memory) > 100
1267                    else memory.memory
1268                )
1269                result += f"{i}. {memory_preview}\n"
1270
1271                # Add topics if available
1272                if hasattr(memory, "topics") and memory.topics:
1273                    result += f"   Topics: {', '.join(memory.topics)}\n"
1274
1275                result += "\n"
1276
1277            logger.info(
1278                "Listed all %d memories for user %s in simplified format",
1279                len(memories),
1280                self.user_id,
1281            )
1282            return result
1283
1284        except Exception as e:
1285            logger.error("Error listing memories: %s", e)
1286            return f" Error listing memories: {str(e)}"
1287
1288    async def store_graph_memory(
1289        self,
1290        content: str,
1291        topics: Union[List[str], str, None] = None,
1292        memory_id: str = None,
1293    ) -> str:
1294        """Store a memory in the LightRAG graph database to capture relationships.
1295
1296        This method creates a text file with the memory content and uploads it to the LightRAG
1297        memory server, which then processes it to extract entities and relationships.
1298
1299        Args:
1300            content: The memory content to store
1301            topics: Optional list of topics/categories for the memory
1302            memory_id: Optional memory ID to link with the SQLite memory
1303
1304        Returns:
1305            str: Success or error message
1306        """
1307        try:
1308            if not self.lightrag_memory_url:
1309                logger.warning("LightRAG memory URL not configured")
1310                return " Graph memory not configured. Memory not stored in graph database."
1311
1312            # Validate content
1313            if not content or not content.strip():
1314                logger.warning("Empty content provided to store_graph_memory")
1315                return " Error: Content cannot be empty."
1316
1317            # Parse topics parameter
1318            topic_list = []
1319            if topics is not None:
1320                if isinstance(topics, str):
1321                    # Convert string to list, handle comma-separated values
1322                    if "," in topics:
1323                        topic_list = [t.strip() for t in topics.split(",") if t.strip()]
1324                    else:
1325                        topic_list = [topics.strip()] if topics.strip() else []
1326                elif isinstance(topics, list):
1327                    # Clean up list - remove empty entries
1328                    topic_list = [str(t).strip() for t in topics if str(t).strip()]
1329                else:
1330                    # Convert anything else to string and put in list
1331                    topic_str = str(topics).strip()
1332                    topic_list = (
1333                        [topic_str] if topic_str and topic_str != "None" else []
1334                    )
1335
1336            # Create a unique filename for this memory
1337            timestamp = int(time.time())
1338            memory_hash = hashlib.md5(f"{content}_{timestamp}".encode()).hexdigest()[:8]
1339
1340            # If memory_id is provided, use it in the filename for traceability
1341            if memory_id:
1342                filename = f"memory_{memory_id}_{memory_hash}.txt"
1343            else:
1344                filename = f"memory_{memory_hash}.txt"
1345
1346            # Prepare the content with metadata
1347            file_content = content
1348
1349            # Add topics as metadata if available
1350            if topic_list:
1351                file_content += f"\n\nTopics: {', '.join(topic_list)}"
1352
1353            # Create a temporary file
1354            with tempfile.NamedTemporaryFile(
1355                mode="w", suffix=".txt", delete=False
1356            ) as temp_file:
1357                temp_file.write(file_content)
1358                temp_file_path = temp_file.name
1359
1360            try:
1361                # Upload the file using the /documents/upload endpoint
1362                url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/documents/upload"
1363
1364                async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
1365                    with open(temp_file_path, "rb") as file:
1366                        # Create form data for file upload
1367                        data = aiohttp.FormData()
1368                        data.add_field(
1369                            "file", file, filename=filename, content_type="text/plain"
1370                        )
1371
1372                        async with session.post(url, data=data, timeout=30) as resp:
1373                            if resp.status in [200, 201]:
1374                                logger.info(
1375                                    "Successfully stored memory in graph database: %s",
1376                                    filename,
1377                                )
1378                                return f" Memory successfully stored in graph database: {content[:50]}..."
1379                            else:
1380                                error_detail = await resp.text()
1381                                logger.warning(
1382                                    f"Failed to store memory in graph: {error_detail}"
1383                                )
1384                                return (
1385                                    f" Error storing memory in graph: {error_detail}"
1386                                )
1387
1388            finally:
1389                # Clean up the temporary file
1390                try:
1391                    os.unlink(temp_file_path)
1392                except OSError:
1393                    pass  # Ignore cleanup errors
1394
1395        except Exception as e:
1396            logger.error("Error storing memory in graph: %s", e)
1397            return f" Error storing memory in graph: {str(e)}"
1398
1399    async def query_graph_memory(
1400        self,
1401        query: str,
1402        mode: str = "mix",
1403        top_k: int = 5,
1404        response_type: str = "Multiple Paragraphs",
1405    ) -> dict:
1406        """Query the LightRAG memory graph to explore relationships between memories.
1407
1408        This method sends a query to the LightRAG memory server to retrieve memories and their
1409        relationships based on the query. It supports different query modes and response formats.
1410
1411        Args:
1412            query: The query to search for in the memory graph
1413            mode: Query mode - "semantic" (vector search), "graph" (graph traversal), or "mix" (combined)
1414            top_k: Maximum number of results to return
1415            response_type: Format of the response - "Multiple Paragraphs", "Single Paragraph", etc.
1416
1417        Returns:
1418            dict: Query results with memories and their relationships
1419        """
1420        try:
1421            if not self.lightrag_memory_url:
1422                logger.warning("LightRAG memory URL not configured")
1423                return {
1424                    "error": "Graph memory not configured. Cannot query graph database."
1425                }
1426
1427            # Validate query
1428            if not query or not query.strip():
1429                logger.warning("Empty query provided to query_graph_memory")
1430                return {"error": "Query cannot be empty. Please provide a search term."}
1431
1432            # Validate mode
1433            valid_modes = ["semantic", "graph", "mix"]
1434            if mode not in valid_modes:
1435                logger.warning(f"Invalid mode '{mode}' provided to query_graph_memory")
1436                mode = "mix"  # Default to mix mode
1437
1438            # Validate response_type
1439            valid_response_types = [
1440                "Multiple Paragraphs",
1441                "Single Paragraph",
1442                "Bullet Points",
1443                "JSON",
1444            ]
1445            if response_type not in valid_response_types:
1446                logger.warning(
1447                    f"Invalid response_type '{response_type}' provided to query_graph_memory"
1448                )
1449                response_type = "Multiple Paragraphs"  # Default to multiple paragraphs
1450
1451            # Prepare the query parameters
1452            params = {
1453                "query": query.strip(),
1454                "mode": mode,
1455                "top_k": top_k,
1456                "response_type": response_type,
1457            }
1458
1459            # Send the query to the LightRAG memory server
1460            url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/query"
1461
1462            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
1463                async with session.get(url, params=params, timeout=60) as resp:
1464                    if resp.status == 200:
1465                        result = await resp.json()
1466                        logger.info(
1467                            f"Successfully queried graph memory: {query[:50]}..."
1468                        )
1469                        return result
1470                    else:
1471                        error_detail = await resp.text()
1472                        logger.warning(f"Failed to query graph memory: {error_detail}")
1473                        return {
1474                            "error": f"Error querying graph memory: {error_detail}",
1475                            "query": query,
1476                            "mode": mode,
1477                        }
1478
1479        except Exception as e:
1480            logger.error(f"Error querying graph memory: {e}")
1481            return {
1482                "error": f"Error querying graph memory: {str(e)}",
1483                "query": query,
1484                "mode": mode,
1485            }
1486
1487    async def get_memory_graph_labels(self) -> str:
1488        """Get the list of all entity and relation labels from the memory graph.
1489
1490        This method retrieves all entity and relation labels from the LightRAG memory graph,
1491        providing insights into the types of information stored in the graph.
1492
1493        Returns:
1494            str: Formatted string with entity and relation labels
1495        """
1496        try:
1497            if not self.lightrag_memory_url:
1498                logger.warning("LightRAG memory URL not configured")
1499                return " Graph memory not configured. Cannot retrieve graph labels."
1500
1501            # Send the request to the LightRAG memory server
1502            url = f"{self.lightrag_memory_url}/graph/label/list"
1503
1504            async with aiohttp.ClientSession() as session:
1505                async with session.get(url, timeout=30) as resp:
1506                    if resp.status == 200:
1507                        data = await resp.json()
1508
1509                        # Handle different response formats
1510                        entity_labels = []
1511                        relation_labels = []
1512
1513                        # Format 1: Direct array of all labels
1514                        if isinstance(data, list):
1515                            all_labels = data
1516                            # We can't distinguish between entity and relation labels in this format
1517                            entity_labels = all_labels
1518
1519                        # Format 2: Dict with 'labels' key containing all labels
1520                        elif isinstance(data, dict) and "labels" in data:
1521                            all_labels = data["labels"]
1522                            # We can't distinguish between entity and relation labels in this format
1523                            entity_labels = all_labels
1524
1525                        # Format 3: Dict with separate 'entity_labels' and 'relation_labels' keys
1526                        elif isinstance(data, dict):
1527                            if "entity_labels" in data:
1528                                entity_labels = data["entity_labels"]
1529                            if "relation_labels" in data:
1530                                relation_labels = data["relation_labels"]
1531
1532                        # Format the result
1533                        result = " MEMORY GRAPH LABELS\n\n"
1534
1535                        if entity_labels:
1536                            result += "Entity Types:\n"
1537                            for label in sorted(entity_labels):
1538                                result += f"- {label}\n"
1539                            result += "\n"
1540
1541                        if relation_labels:
1542                            result += "Relation Types:\n"
1543                            for label in sorted(relation_labels):
1544                                result += f"- {label}\n"
1545
1546                        if not entity_labels and not relation_labels:
1547                            result += "No labels found in the memory graph. Try storing some memories first!"
1548
1549                        logger.info("Retrieved memory graph labels successfully")
1550                        return result
1551                    else:
1552                        error_detail = await resp.text()
1553                        logger.warning(
1554                            f"Failed to retrieve graph labels: {error_detail}"
1555                        )
1556                        return f" Error retrieving graph labels: {error_detail}"
1557
1558        except Exception as e:
1559            logger.error(f"Error retrieving memory graph labels: {e}")
1560            return f" Error retrieving memory graph labels: {str(e)}"

Manages memory operations including storage, retrieval, and updates.

AgentMemoryManager( user_id: str, storage_dir: str, agno_memory=None, lightrag_url: Optional[str] = None, lightrag_memory_url: Optional[str] = None, enable_memory: bool = True) 
32    def __init__(
33        self,
34        user_id: str,
35        storage_dir: str,
36        agno_memory=None,
37        lightrag_url: Optional[str] = None,
38        lightrag_memory_url: Optional[str] = None,
39        enable_memory: bool = True,
40    ):
41        """Initialize the memory manager.
42
43        Args:
44            user_id: User identifier for memory operations
45            storage_dir: Directory for storage files
46            agno_memory: Optional initialized agno memory instance
47            lightrag_url: Optional URL for LightRAG API
48            lightrag_memory_url: Optional URL for LightRAG Memory API
49            enable_memory: Whether memory is enabled
50        """
51        self.user_id = user_id
52        self.storage_dir = storage_dir
53        self.agno_memory = agno_memory
54        self.lightrag_url = lightrag_url
55        self.lightrag_memory_url = lightrag_memory_url
56        self.enable_memory = enable_memory
